original: gser du snang ba na de bzhin nyid du snang ba zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gser du snang ba na de bzhin nyid du snang ba zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it appears as gold, it is said to appear as suchness, because it has that nature.

original: sa'i khams ni gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang gser gnyis kyi cha dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i khams ni gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang gser gnyis kyi cha dang ldan pa ste /

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi dpe'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi dpe'o //

original: sa dang gser ni kun brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: sa dang gser ni kun brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa'i dpe'o //
translated: Earth and gold are examples of the imagined and the perfect.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe dang bstun par bya ba la dpe gtod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe dang bstun par bya ba la dpe gtod pa ste /
translated: In the same way, in order to illustrate the meaning of the example, the example is introduced.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do /

original: brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa gnyis kyi cha dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa gnyis kyi cha dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has the part of both the imagined and the perfect.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i @232b ye shes kyi mes reg pa na yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i cha snang ba dang mi snang ba go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i @232b ye shes kyi mes reg pa na yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i cha snang ba dang mi snang ba go rims bzhin no //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis la lar ni chos thams cad rtog go zhes bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan gyi dbang gi chos nyid de bzhin nyid gang yin pa des de rlug go //üîΩkun brtags pa'i chas mi rtag pa ste /üîΩde la rtag pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrtag pa med pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes nges pa'i tshig go //

translated: The Lord has taught in some places that all dharmas are imagined, etc. The imagined nature is impermanent in terms of the imagined aspect, because it does not exist.üîΩThe dependent nature is impermanent in terms of the imagined aspect, because it is not permanent.

original: gnyi ga'i chas rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i chas rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa nyid do //

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos bde ba dag go //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos bde ba dag go //
translated: The perfected nature is blissful in terms of the perfected aspect, because it is the object of the blissful intuition of the noble ones.

original: kun brtags pa'i chas sdug bsngal dag go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chas sdug bsngal dag go //
translated: The imagined nature is suffering in terms of the imagined aspect, because it is the object of suffering intuition.üîΩThe dependent nature is suffering in terms of the imagined aspect, because it is the object of suffering intuition.üîΩThe perfected nature is not suffering in terms of both aspects, because it is not suffering.üîΩThe imagined nature is empty in terms of the imagined aspect, because it does not exist.üîΩThe dependent nature is empty in terms of the imagined aspect, because it is not that.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi chas gnyis su med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi chas gnyis su med do //

analyzed: bde blag tu blang bar bya ba dang zin par bya ba'i phyir //

analyzed: chos med pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i don du bstan to //

analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de bzhin med //

analyzed: gang phyir de ltar snang gyur ba //

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi la sogs pa med @233a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi la sogs pa med @233a * //

analyzed: bde ba ni da ltar gyi dga' ba ste /

original: dper na 'dod pa can rnams kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i yul la nye bar spyod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa can rnams kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i yul la nye bar spyod pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the enjoyment of sense objects by those with passion.

original: phan pa dang bde ba ni da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa na dga' ba ste /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba ni da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa na dga' ba ste /
translated: Benefit and happiness is joy in the present and in the future,

original: dper na 'dod chags chung ngu'i tshangs par spyod pa de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags chung ngu'i tshangs par spyod pa de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the practice of celibacy for those with little passion.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa na lus can rnams bde ba bla na med pa la brten par ji ltar 'gyur zhig gu snyam du dad pa dang 'dun pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bsam pa shas che ba ni lhag pa'i
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa na lus can rnams bde ba bla na med pa la brten par ji ltar 'gyur zhig gu snyam du dad pa dang 'dun pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bsam pa shas che ba ni lhag pa'i
translated: The bodhisattvas have a superior intention, which is the predominance of the attitude that has the nature of faith and aspiration, thinking, how can i now and in the future establish embodied beings in unsurpassable bliss?

original: bsam pa'o // thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa zhes bya ba ni gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i las kyis ston te /
analyzed: bsam pa'o // thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa zhes bya ba ni gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i las kyis ston te /
translated: The statement, they introduce them to the pristine wisdom of omniscience, reveals their function by way of a sequential process.

original: mar me las mar me stong du mched par byed pa bzhin du gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i las kyis phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mar me las mar me stong du mched par byed pa bzhin du gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i las kyis phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Just as one lamp can light a thousand other lamps, the sequential process of their function reveals their superior intention to benefit and bring happiness.

original: de bzhin du tshig 'og ma thams cad la yang phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bshad pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig 'og ma thams cad la yang phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bshad pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The explanation of their superior intention to benefit and bring happiness should be applied in the same way to all the following verses.

original: la la ni phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa can yin yang phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba yod pas /
analyzed: la la ni phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa can yin yang phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba yod pas /
translated: Some, although they have the superior intention to benefit and gladden others, are mistaken.

original: bdag ci ri zhes bya ba'i shes pas phyin ci log med pa'i las bstan te /
analyzed: bdag ci ri zhes bya ba'i shes pas phyin ci log med pa'i las bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the S≈´tra teaches the action of one who is not mistaken, with the statement, ‚ÄúI will know myself.‚Äù

original: bdag shes pa ni phyin ci ma log par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag shes pa ni phyin ci ma log par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who knows himself is not mistaken in his application.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag shes pa'i yon tan mtshungs pa med /
analyzed: bdag shes pa'i yon tan mtshungs pa med /
translated: The virtue of knowing oneself is matchless.

original: bdag mi shes pa'i dri ma mtshungs pa med /üîΩlha dang mir bcas pa'i 'gro ba 'di /
analyzed: bdag mi shes pa'i dri ma mtshungs pa med / lha dang mir bcas pa'i 'gro ba 'di /
translated: The stain of not knowing oneself is matchless.

original: cha 'di gnyis kyis brgyad cing gnod par 'gyur zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: cha 'di gnyis kyis brgyad cing gnod par 'gyur zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This world of gods and humans is afflicted and harmed by these two.

original: de skad du /üîΩbdag shes pa ni snying gi rtsa lag gyur pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du / bdag shes pa ni snying gi rtsa lag gyur pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang bshad do //
translated: And it is said:üîΩKnowing oneself, one becomes a friend to oneself.

original: nga rgyal bcom pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nga rgyal bcom pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The S≈´tra teaches the action of one who has conquered pride with the statement, ‚ÄúI will not be led by others.‚Äù

original: @239b gzhan gyis byed du ma bcug par bdag nyid sbyor ba'i las kyis bshad de /
analyzed: @239b gzhan gyis byed du ma bcug par bdag nyid sbyor ba'i las kyis bshad de /
translated: The action of one who is not led by others is taught by the action of applying oneself.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa la mi sdod par chos ston par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa la mi sdod par chos ston par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not remain in the request for Dharma, but rather engages in teaching the Dharma.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'khrugs pa'i las kyis ston te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'khrugs pa'i las kyis ston te /
translated: The teaching of superior intention is shown by the action of non-disturbance.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis sems skyo bar byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis sems skyo bar byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sufferings of cyclic existence cannot disturb the mind.

original: bcos ma yin par byams pa dang / mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba la sems snyoms pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' bar du gtan du mdza' ba zhes bya ba gsum ni zang zing med pa'i las rnam pa gsum gyis 'chad de /
analyzed: bcos ma yin par byams pa dang / mdza' ba dang / mi mdza' ba la sems snyoms pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' bar du gtan du mdza' ba zhes bya ba gsum ni zang zing med pa'i las rnam pa gsum gyis 'chad de /
translated: The three: fabricated love, equanimity towards friends and foes, and love that lasts until the end of samsara, are explained by three types of action free from material things.

original: de la zang zing dang ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la zang zing dang ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Among them, in the phrase not connected with material things,

original: zang zing gi phyir byams pa de ni bcos pa ste //
analyzed: zang zing gi phyir byams pa de ni bcos pa ste //
translated: that love for the sake of material things is fabricated.

original: rnyed pa yod kyi bar du byams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed pa yod kyi bar du byams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is love as long as there is gain.

original: zang zing med par byams pa ni bcos ma ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: zang zing med par byams pa ni bcos ma ma yin pa ste /
translated: Love free from material things is not fabricated.

original: dus thams cad du med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not cease at any time.

original: su gang zang zing la rag lus te mdza' ba ni mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: su gang zang zing la rag lus te mdza' ba ni mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang ldan te /
translated: Love that is dependent on material things is associated with attachment and aversion toward the loved one and the unloved one, respectively.

original: sems snyoms par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems snyoms par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mind is not impartial.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni gnyi ga la yang sems snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni gnyi ga la yang sems snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: But one who has a mind free of material things enters into impartiality toward both.

original: zang zing gis byas pa'i mdza' ba la mthun par byed pa ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mthun par byed pa ste /
analyzed: zang zing gis byas pa'i mdza' ba la mthun par byed pa ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du mthun par byed pa ste /
translated: Love that is produced by material things is friendly only as long as the material things continue.

original: gtan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan du ma yin no //
translated: It is not permanent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni zang zing med par byams pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni zang zing med par byams pa ste /
translated: But the bodhisattva‚Äôs love is free of material things.

original: tshe rabs gzhan dag na yang rjes su mthun par byed pas mya ngan las 'das pa la thug gi bar du gtan du byams so //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan dag na yang rjes su mthun par byed pas mya ngan las 'das pa la thug gi bar du gtan du byams so //
translated: It is friendly permanently, even in other lives, because it is practiced continuously.

original: tshigs ran pa dang 'dzum pa'i bzhin gyis gsod por smra ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mthun pa'i ngag dang lus kyis las kyis bshad do //
analyzed: tshigs ran pa dang 'dzum pa'i bzhin gyis gsod por smra ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mthun pa'i ngag dang lus kyis las kyis bshad do //
translated: The two, speaking pleasantly with a smiling face and speaking at the right time, are explained as actions of speech and body that are consistent with the superior intention to bring about benefit and happiness.

original: snying rje chen po yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis su med par mnyam pa nyid kyi las kyis bshad de /
analyzed: snying rje chen po yongs su ma chad pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis su med par mnyam pa nyid kyi las kyis bshad de /
translated: The action of great compassion that is uninterrupted is explained as the action of the sameness of the nondiscrimination of happiness and suffering.

original: su dag sdug bsngal ba nyid dag la snying rje 'jug gi /
analyzed: su dag sdug bsngal ba nyid dag la snying rje 'jug gi /
translated: Compassion engages only those who are suffering,üîΩnot those who are happy.

original: bde ba rnams la ni ma yin pa de'i las ni ma snyoms pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba rnams la ni ma yin pa de'i las ni ma snyoms pa ste /
translated: Its action is not balanced,

original: gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa yang rung /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro // byang chub sems dpa' ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa yang rung /
translated: because it does not engage in the other.

original: sems can du bsdus pa rnams 'du byed kyi sdug @240a * //
analyzed: sems can du bsdus pa rnams 'du byed kyi sdug @240a * //
translated: But the bodhisattva engages in the happiness of those who are happy, in the suffering of those who are suffering, and in the indifference of those who are neither happy nor suffering.üîΩThe action of the bodhisattva is balanced,üîΩbecause it engages in all three.

original: bsngal nyid dang ldan pas de dag la bye brag med par snying rje ba'i phyir las mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: bsngal nyid dang ldan pas de dag la bye brag med par snying rje ba'i phyir las mnyam pa yin no //
translated: Their activity is the same, because they are compassionate toward those who are suffering, without making distinctions among them.

original: khur blangs pa rnams la sgyid lug pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi zhum pa'i las kyis brjod do //
analyzed: khur blangs pa rnams la sgyid lug pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mi zhum pa'i las kyis brjod do //
translated: ‚Äú They are not discouraged about taking on burdens‚Äù shows their activity of not being fainthearted.

original: sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i bur la brtson par byas pa'i rtsol ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ji ltar dam bcas pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i bur la brtson par byas pa'i rtsol ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ji ltar dam bcas pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They accomplish what they have promised, because they do not give up the effort they have made to liberate all sentient beings.

original: yid yongs su mi skyo ba zhes bya ba ni mi bzlog pa'i las kyi rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: yid yongs su mi skyo ba zhes bya ba ni mi bzlog pa'i las kyi rnam par 'grel te /
translated: ‚Äú Their minds are not at all weary‚Äù shows their activity of not turning back.

original: sems can log pa bsgrubs pas phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mthun pa'i las las bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can log pa bsgrubs pas phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mthun pa'i las las bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They cannot be turned away from their activity of having the superior intention to benefit and bring happiness to sentient beings, even when they are treated wrongly.

original: thos pa dang don gyis ngoms mi myong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thos pa dang don gyis ngoms mi myong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú They are insatiable in listening and in the meaning‚Äù

original: thabs yongs su 'dzin pa'i las kyis rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: thabs yongs su 'dzin pa'i las kyis rnam par 'byed do //
translated: shows their activity of taking up skillful means.

original: mnyan pa yin pas thos pa ste /
analyzed: mnyan pa yin pas thos pa ste /
translated: They listen, because they are students.

original: mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams yin gyi mnyan par bya ba gang ci yang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams yin gyi mnyan par bya ba gang ci yang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: The Dharma is the Sutras and so on, not just anything that is heard.

original: don ni de dag nyid kyis brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni de dag nyid kyis brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is what is expressed by them.

original: thos pa dang / don gnyis la ngoms mi myong ba ni chog mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang / don gnyis la ngoms mi myong ba ni chog mi shes pa ste /
translated: Insatiability in listening and in the meaning is non-satisfaction.

original: de ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs yongs su 'dzin pa'i las te /
analyzed: de ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs yongs su 'dzin pa'i las te /
translated: This is the function of holding the means of bringing beings to maturity,

original: thos pa dang don gyis mi ngoms pa ni skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang yi ge 'brel pa rnams kyis chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa dang don gyis mi ngoms pa ni skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshig dang yi ge 'brel pa rnams kyis chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one teaches the Dharma with words and syllables that are connected according to the capacity of the listener, without being satisfied with listening and the meaning.

original: tshig gnyis kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Two verses on the function of turning away from the resistances.

original: bdag gi 'khrul pa rnams la nyes par lta ba dang / gzhan gyi 'khrul pa rnams la mi gshe bar bsgo ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: bdag gi 'khrul pa rnams la nyes par lta ba dang / gzhan gyi 'khrul pa rnams la mi gshe bar bsgo ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis so //
translated: 1. Seeing faults in one's own transgressions, and not being angry at the transgression of another, are the function of turning away from the resistances.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'dod chags sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'dod chags sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the resistances are passion and so on.

original: de las 'dun pa bzlog pa ni phyir bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de las 'dun pa bzlog pa ni phyir bzlog pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is the reversal of intention.

original: bdag gi 'khrul pa'i skyon yang dag par mthong na de las ldog go //
analyzed: bdag gi 'khrul pa'i skyon yang dag par mthong na de las ldog go //
translated: If one sees the fault of one‚Äôs own error, one turns away from it.

original: legs pa bsdams pas kyang tshig gzung bar 'os pas gzhan dag bya ba ma yin pa las bzlog par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: legs pa bsdams pas kyang tshig gzung bar 'os pas gzhan dag bya ba ma yin pa las bzlog par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, one who is well restrained is worthy to be heeded, and so is able to turn others away from what should not be done, but not others.

original: ji skad du /üîΩgnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
analyzed: ji skad du / gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang bdag log par zhugs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang bdag log par zhugs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is impossible and out of the question for one who has gone wrong to be able to turn others away from going wrong.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten na yang //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang //
translated: And in the world,

original: rang gi nyes la nyes shes na //
analyzed: rang gi nyes la nyes shes na //
translated: When one recognizes one‚Äôs own faults,

original: dus zhig na ni 'bral bar 'gyur //üîΩde la yon tan 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: dus zhig na ni 'bral bar 'gyur // de la yon tan 'dzin pa yi //
translated: One is separated from them in time.üîΩBut one who is proud

original: nga rgyal can la 'bral mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes brjod do //
analyzed: nga rgyal can la 'bral mi 'gyur // zhes brjod do //
translated: Of holding to one‚Äôs own qualities is not separated from them.

original: su zhig ltung @240b ba 'byung ba la phan par 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: su zhig ltung @240b ba 'byung ba la phan par 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: One who is not intent on the welfare of those who have fallen into error,

original: khros te gleng na de'i tshig de yang gzung bar 'os pa ma yin pas je mi mthun zhing log par sgrub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: khros te gleng na de'i tshig de yang gzung bar 'os pa ma yin pas je mi mthun zhing log par sgrub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If he were to speak angrily, his words would not be worth taking to heart, and so he would only create more disharmony and wrongdoing.

original: bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar byams pa skyes pa ni lhung ba yang gleng bar byed la /
analyzed: bu gcig pa dang 'dra bar byams pa skyes pa ni lhung ba yang gleng bar byed la /
translated: But when he has given rise to love, as if for his only son, he will speak of the downfall.

original: phyin cad mi bya ba'i sdom pa yang 'dzin tu 'jug go ;üîΩ; spyod lam thams cad du byang chub kyi sems yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyin cad mi bya ba'i sdom pa yang 'dzin tu 'jug go ; ; spyod lam thams cad du byang chub kyi sems yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And he will make the person take a vow not to do it again.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par de yid la byed pa'i las kyis de shes par byed do //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par de yid la byed pa'i las kyis de shes par byed do //
translated: ‚Äú Training in the Thought of Enlightenment in all activities‚Äù means that by the action of constantly keeping that in mind, one makes it known.

original: de zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the superior intention to bring about benefit and happiness.

original: byed pa thams cad du byang chub kyi sems yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byed pa thams cad du byang chub kyi sems yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is because one trains in the Thought of Enlightenment in all activities.

original: spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the S≈´tra on the Purity of the Sphere of Activity:üîΩ‚Äú

original: 'dug pa na 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par gyur cig ces sems bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dug pa na 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyang chub kyi snying po la 'dug par gyur cig ces sems bskyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: When sitting, one should arouse the following thought: ‚ÄúMay all living beings sit on the seat of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: tshig bdun gyis khyad par du 'gro ba'i las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig bdun gyis khyad par du 'gro ba'i las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The practice of advancement is sevenfold:

original: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: generosity without hope of karmic reward,

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis zin pa'i thabs zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis zin pa'i thabs zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: and the means of retention by the four social practices.

original: gong nas gong du rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa'i gnas skabs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po ji skad smos pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par bsal ba rnams dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams ni khyad zhugs par khyad par du 'gro ba 'phel ba 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa'i gnas skabs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po ji skad smos pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par bsal ba rnams dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams ni khyad zhugs par khyad par du 'gro ba 'phel ba 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of attaining the advancement of the perfections on the stages of the bodhisattva, beginning with the stage of the joyous, is the complete elimination of the resistances to the six perfections as they have been described, and the four social practices.

original: las ni bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las ni bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Practice is action.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to /
translated: Four perfections are explained by the words of the verse itself.

original: gang la khyad par yod pa de bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la khyad par yod pa de bshad par bya ste /
translated: The special point will be explained.

original: de na sems can gyi don bya ba mi mthong ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs med pa'i khams su mi skye'o //

analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa khong du chud par bya'o //

original: 'dod bzhin phun sum tshogs lus thob //

analyzed: spangs pa dge ldan zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa spangs pa'i dge bas dge ba dang ldan pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: phun sum tshogs de zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i sangs rgyas nyid do //

analyzed: gnas bzhi spong ba zhes gang smos pa'i spang bar bya ba de dag ston te /

original: yid la byed pa spangs pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid la byed pa spangs pas zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: yid gnyis dang som nyi spangs zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i zab pa nyid dang rgya che ba nyid la yid gnyis phyin ci log dang theg tsom med par bya'o //

analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa'i chos la ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa spang bar bya ste /

translated: This is my meaning.üîΩ By abandoning conceptualization means that one abandons all conceptualizations, such as the spontaneous presence of form and so on without being placed in front, and the sign of the object placed by one who desires concentration, such as a skeleton, and so on.

analyzed: rnam par byang ba ba'i keng rus la sogs pa bzhag pa dmigs par gyur pa'i mtshan ma de thams cad yid la mi byed pas rnam par mi rtog par spong ba'am /

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan ma'i bar la /
translated: From the perfections up to the names of the buddhas and bodhisattvas,üîΩ

analyzed: de ni 'di yin no zhes mngon par zhen nas rnam par rtog par mi byed pa'o //

analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //

analyzed: gang gis ji ltar 'jug ce na //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byed pa dang 'di ltar bya ba 'dri ba'o //

original: des na gnyi ga ston to //

original: yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi zhes bya bas ni 'di ltar bya ba ston to //üîΩsbyor ba'i dus na ni yongs su tshol ba ste /

translated: The four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.üîΩThe four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result.üîΩThe four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.üîΩThe four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result.

original: nges par rtog pa'i rnam pa'i lta ba dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i yongs su rtog pa'o //üîΩdmigs pa med par nges pa'i ye shes ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: nges par rtog pa'i rnam pa'i lta ba dmigs pa med pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i yongs su rtog pa'o // dmigs pa med par nges pa'i ye shes ni 'bras bu'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.üîΩThe four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result.üîΩThe four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result.üîΩThe four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.

original: de la ming ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha tshig go //üîΩming de yongs su tshol ba ni yid kyi brjod pa tsam nyid du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de la ming ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tha tshig go // ming de yongs su tshol ba ni yid kyi brjod pa tsam nyid du rtog pa ste /
translated: The four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result.üîΩThe four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.üîΩThe four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result.üîΩThe four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.üîΩThe four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result.üîΩThe four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.üîΩThe four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result.

original: yid kyi brjod pa las gud na med pas brtags par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi brjod pa las gud na med pas brtags par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four investigations are at the time of practice, because one investigates the four realities by way of the four investigations.üîΩThe four knowledges of reality as it is are at the time of the result, because they are the nature of the result

original: dngos po yongs su tshol ba ni ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pas phung po dang khams la sogs par brjod pa de bzhin du yongs su grub pa med par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po yongs su tshol ba ni ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pas phung po dang khams la sogs par brjod pa de bzhin du yongs su grub pa med par rtog pa ste /
translated: The investigation of things is the understanding that the aggregates, elements, etc. are not established as they are expressed by the collections of names, etc.

original: rigs dang rigs can gyi 'brel pa tha dad na de dang ldan pa'i brjod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs dang rigs can gyi 'brel pa tha dad na de dang ldan pa'i brjod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the relation between the class and the individual were different, the expression of their relation would be impossible.

original: ming gi dngos po brjod par bya ba'i don gang yin pa ming la brten pa'i brjod par bya ba de la yang yid kyi brjod pa tsam du zad par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: ming gi dngos po brjod par bya ba'i don gang yin pa ming la brten pa'i brjod par bya ba de la yang yid kyi brjod pa tsam du zad par rtog par byed de /
translated: One should understand that the object which is expressed by the name, i.e., the object which is the basis of the name, is merely a mental expression.

original: phyi rol gyi rnam par 'dzin pa las zlog cing /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam par 'dzin pa las zlog cing /
translated: One should turn away from the apprehension of external things,

original: nang gi yan lag tu nye bar rtog par byed do //
analyzed: nang gi yan lag tu nye bar rtog par byed do //
translated: and one should understand that the object is a part of the mind.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de yang yang na ni ngo bo nyid du brtags pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig de yang yang na ni ngo bo nyid du brtags pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: The word ‚Äúform,‚Äù etc. is either a nature imagined as an entity,

original: lus dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: such as ‚Äúbody,‚Äù ‚Äúfeeling,‚Äù etc.

analyzed: gang zag brtags pa ltar med bzhin du yang ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang na ni khyad par du gdags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yang na ni khyad par du gdags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Or else, it is the characteristic of designation as a particular,

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: mi bzhin du khyad par 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bzhin du khyad par 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is designated as a particular, like a human being.

original: ming dang bcas pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ming dang brjod par bya ba dang bcas pa'o //üîΩngo bo nyid dang khyad par du btags pa dang bcas shing zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi sgra gnyis dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang bcas pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ming dang brjod par bya ba dang bcas pa'o // ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du btags pa dang bcas shing zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi sgra gnyis dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving a name and an object‚Äù means having a name and an object of expression.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúhaving an essential nature and a particular‚Äù means having the two words ‚Äúessential nature‚Äù and ‚Äúparticular.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du bcas pa zhes bya ba ni don gnyis dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du bcas pa zhes bya ba ni don gnyis dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving an essential nature and a particular‚Äù means having two objects.

original: 'di thams cad don gyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun brtags pa'i don mi dmigs par nges par sems pa'i rnam pa yongs su tshol ba bzhi po thabs su gyur pa rnams kyi 'bras bu yang dag pa ji lta
analyzed: 'di thams cad don gyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun brtags pa'i don mi dmigs par nges par sems pa'i rnam pa yongs su tshol ba bzhi po thabs su gyur pa rnams kyi 'bras bu yang dag pa ji lta
translated: When all of these are not apprehended as the characteristics of objects, etc.

original: ba bzhin du shes pa rnam pa bzhi nyid do //
analyzed: ba bzhin du shes pa rnam pa bzhi nyid do //
translated: The four kinds of thorough investigation that are the means for ascertaining the nonapprehension of the imagined object are the four kinds of results that are the correct knowledge of things as they are.

original: de dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni @245a * //
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni @245a * //
translated: Because they are not apprehended.

original: ming la sogs par mi dmigs par nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming la sogs par mi dmigs par nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they are ascertained as not apprehended as names, etc.

original: nges par rtog pa'i yongs su tshol ba'i 'bras bu ni mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: nges par rtog pa'i yongs su tshol ba'i 'bras bu ni mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The result of the thorough investigation of discernment is nonapprehension.

original: ming yongs su tshol ba'i 'bras bu ni ming mi dmigs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: ming yongs su tshol ba'i 'bras bu ni ming mi dmigs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The result of the thorough investigation of names is the knowledge of the nonapprehension of names.

original: dngos po yongs su tshol ba'i 'bras bu ni dngos po mi dmigs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su tshol ba'i 'bras bu ni dngos po mi dmigs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The result of the thorough investigation of things is the knowledge of the nonapprehension of things.

original: de bzhin du ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du gdags pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du gdags pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the designations of entityness and the distinctions.

original: gal te don med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te don med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la 'jug na /
translated: If one enters into mere representation because of the non-existence of objects,

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de la 'jug ces ji skad bya zhes bya bas spong bar byed de /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de la 'jug ces ji skad bya zhes bya bas spong bar byed de /

original: de nyid 'di'i don yin par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i don yin par bsams pa'o //

original: de dgag pa'i phyir de tsam nyid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir de tsam nyid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to refute this, he says, ‚Äúbecause of the existence of that much.‚Äù

original: rnam par rig pa'i don gyis kyang don med pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i don gyis kyang don med pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of representation is also non-existent.

original: phyi rol 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not only external objects that are non-existent.

original: gal te don med pa nyid yin na skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa bshad pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i don gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don med pa nyid yin na skye mched bcu gnyis la sogs pa bshad pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i don gyi tha snyad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If it is non-existent, how can one explain the twelve sense-fields, etc., and how can one follow worldly conventions?

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan dang lta ba dang bcas pa gnyis zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan dang lta ba dang bcas pa gnyis zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause of the existence of that much,‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of the existence of both the sign and the view.‚Äù

original: don med bzhin du yang phyir rol gyi don du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa ni don mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis 'grub la /
analyzed: don med bzhin du yang phyir rol gyi don du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa ni don mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis 'grub la /
translated: Even though it is non-existent, the representation that appears as an external object is established by the power of the latent impressions of the verbal expression of objects.

original: rnam par rig pa snang ba yang lta ba zhes bya ba btags pas 'gal ba med do /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa snang ba yang lta ba zhes bya ba btags pas 'gal ba med do /
translated: The appearance of consciousness is also called seeing, so there is no contradiction.

original: ci rgyu mtshan dang lta bar snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'di dag rigs gzhan du gyur ba nyid ces 'jug par byed dam /
analyzed: ci rgyu mtshan dang lta bar snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'di dag rigs gzhan du gyur ba nyid ces 'jug par byed dam /
translated: Do these consciousnesses that appear as objects and seeing belong to different classes?

original: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Or do they not?

original: de'i phyir sna tshogs kyi rnam pa nyid la 'jug ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sna tshogs kyi rnam pa nyid la 'jug ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they engage in the aspect of diversity.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por rnam pa tha dad pas dus gcig tu rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo zhes 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por rnam pa tha dad pas dus gcig tu rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo zhes 'jug go //
translated: A single consciousness appears as diverse aspects simultaneously because of the difference between the object grasped and the grasper.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig nyid rnam pa mang por rang gis rig go //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni shes pa gcig nyid rnam pa mang por rang gis rig go //
translated: Diversity means that a single consciousness is aware of itself in many aspects.üîΩThese three types of conceptualization are explained by the context of the three liberations.

original: rtog pa rnam pa 'di gsum rnam par dgrol ba'i skabs kyis ming la sogs pa don rnam pa drug don med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: rtog pa rnam pa 'di gsum rnam par dgrol ba'i skabs kyis ming la sogs pa don rnam pa drug don med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsum bstan to //
translated: The three statements beginning with ‚ÄúName, etc., are meaningless with respect to the six types of objects‚Äù are taught.

original: ci 'dra bar ni 'jug ces gang smos pa de'i dper /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar ni 'jug ces gang smos pa de'i dper /
translated: As for the statement ‚ÄúHow do they engage?‚Äù an example is given.

original: mun khung na sprul du snang ba'i thag pa bzhin du 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mun khung na sprul du snang ba'i thag pa bzhin du 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Just as a rope appears as a snake in the dark, so the three realities are realized.

original: dpes ngo bo nyid gsum rtogs par ston to //
analyzed: dpes ngo bo nyid gsum rtogs par ston to //
translated: The three realities are taught by the example.

original: dper na med pa'i phyir thag pa la sprul ni nor pa ste /
analyzed: dper na med pa'i phyir thag pa la sprul ni nor pa ste /
translated: For example, a rope is mistaken for a snake because of non-existence.

original: de bzhin du ming la sogs pa don rnam pa drug gis yi ge dang don du snang ba'i yid kyi @245b brjod pa gzhan gyi dbar la ming la sogs pa yang nor ba yin no //

translated: In the same way, names and so on are mistaken for the six kinds of objects, such as the object of expression, because of the mental expression of letters and objects.

original: de la ji ltar thag pa'i blo la brten nas med pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir sprul gyi blo ldog pa med pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang la brten nas ming la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i don rnam pa drug gi blo rnam par ldog go //

translated: Just as the idea of a snake is eliminated in dependence on the idea of a rope because of the error of non-existence, in the same way, the idea of the six kinds of objects imagined in names and so on is eliminated in dependence on the other-dependent.

analyzed: ces bshad do //

analyzed: med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: don yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam pa drug po med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa la brten nas gzhan gyi dbang 'khrul pa yang bzlog par bya ba yin te /
translated: Based on the perfected nature, which has the characteristic of the non-existence of the six unreal meanings, the dependent nature, which is delusion, should also be eliminated,

analyzed: bstsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: which means it should be determined.üîΩBy engaging with the characteristic of the object that appears as mental expression,

analyzed: yid kyi brjod par snang ba'i don gyi mtshan nyid la 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni yid kyi brjod pa 'di don du snang gi /

analyzed: kun brtags par bya ba'i don ni med do //üîΩzhes kun brtags pa la 'jug go //

translated: The phrase by entering into vij√±apti-mƒÅtra means that this vij√±apti-mƒÅtra is deluded by the power of ignorance, and that, although there is no object, the appearance of an object is a delusion.üîΩThe phrase the elimination of the notion of an object refers to the stage of entering into the perfected nature.

analyzed: don gyi 'du shes bstsal zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: don du snang ba thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas skabs med pa yin no //
analyzed: don du snang ba thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas skabs med pa yin no //
translated: There is no occasion for the appearance of an object.

original: zhes bya ba ni don du snang ba gang gis kyang skyed mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩdes na rnam par rig pa tsam du snang ba yang mi 'byung zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don du snang ba gang gis kyang skyed mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // des na rnam par rig pa tsam du snang ba yang mi 'byung zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase there is no occasion for the appearance of an object means that it is impossible for an object to appear.üîΩTherefore, the appearance of vij√±apti-mƒÅtra also does not occur.üîΩ The phrase therefore, the appearance of vij√±apti-mƒÅtra also does not occur means that if there is no object, there is no subject.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam don du byas nas mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam don du byas nas mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the appearance of vij√±apti-mƒÅtra does not occur means that it does not occur in the sense that vij√±apti-mƒÅtra is the object.

original: don thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ming la gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ming gi spyod yul mdo la sogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag gis ma 'bags pa la 'di thams cad ni ming tsam mo zhes bya bar rnam par
analyzed: don thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ming la gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ming gi spyod yul mdo la sogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag gis ma 'bags pa la 'di thams cad ni ming tsam mo zhes bya bar rnam par
translated: And, abiding in the name of non-conceptuality with regard to all objects, etc. means that one abides in the knowledge that all these dharmas of the domain of names, such as sutras, are only names, without being defiled by them.

original: gnas shing ste /
analyzed: gnas shing ste /
translated: One abides in the knowledge that all these dharmas of the domain of names, such as sutras, are only names, without being defiled by them.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: thams cad ming tsam kho na ste //
analyzed: thams cad ming tsam kho na ste //

original: rtog pa thams cad 'jug pa med //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad 'jug pa med //

original: ming du snang ba'i rnam rig la //
analyzed: ming du snang ba'i rnam rig la //

original: @246a * // ming zhes nye bar 'dogs par byed //

original: ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces bshad pa lta bu'o //

original: chos kyi dbyings la mngon sum gyi tshul gyis gnas so zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis mngon sum du byed pas gnas kyi mos pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la mngon sum gyi tshul gyis gnas so zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis mngon sum du byed pas gnas kyi mos pas ni ma yin no //
translated: One abides in the dharma-dhƒÅtu by way of direct perception means that one abides in the dharma-dhƒÅtu by direct personal experience, not by faith.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam pa'i ye shes bya ba ni ji ltar dmigs par bya ba med pa de bzhin du dmigs par byed pa yang med pas dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa gnyis mnyam pas mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam pa'i ye shes bya ba ni ji ltar dmigs par bya ba med pa de bzhin du dmigs par byed pa yang med pas dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa gnyis mnyam pas mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The wisdom of equality is so called because the object of observation and the observer are equal. Just as the object of observation does not exist, so also the observer does not exist. Therefore, the object of observation and the observer are equal, and thus they are equality.

original: de ltar na 'di yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i byed pa po'i spyod pa med par gyur pa'i mthar thug pa ston to ;
analyzed: de ltar na 'di yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i byed pa po'i spyod pa med par gyur pa'i mthar thug pa ston to ;

original: ; brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang la 'jug pa ni lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i bya ba mthar thug pa ma yin pas byed pa po nyid du brjod par 'dod pas 'jug par bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: don thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ming la zhes gang bshad pa yul dang bcas pa'i ming de rab tu dbye ba ni tshigs su bcad pas ston te /

translated: Because he is born in the lineage of the Tathagata, as a son of the Buddha, after realizing the first stage, therefore the noble Maitreya, dwelling on the tenth stage, is distinguished as the eldest son of Sakyamuni in the Adornment of the Scriptures of the Universal Vehicle.

original: rgyan gyis bstod pa las //
analyzed: rgyan gyis bstod pa las //

analyzed: de dag bstan pa kun gyi spyi bor gnas //

original: de phyir khyod nyid sh'akya thub pa yi //
analyzed: de phyir khyod nyid sh'akya thub pa yi //

original: zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher 'byung ngo //

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni thams cad la bdag med par mnyam par nyid du mthong ba'i phyir te /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sems mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gnas gang yin pa de bdag gi yang yin no snyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has attained an attitude of sameness toward all bodhisattvas means that he thinks, That which is their abode is also mine.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la sems mnyam pa thob pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de dag chos kyi sku gang yin pa de bdag gis kyang thob bo snyam pa'i phyir ro de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi mthong ba'i
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la sems mnyam pa thob pa yin te zhes bya ba ni de dag chos kyi sku gang yin pa de bdag gis kyang thob bo snyam pa'i phyir ro de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi mthong ba'i
translated: He has attained an attitude of sameness toward all buddhas means that he thinks, That which is their Dharma body is also mine.

original: lam bzhin du chos kyi dbyings sngon ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam bzhin du chos kyi dbyings sngon ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is his path of seeing means that, like the path of seeing of the sravakas, he sees the previously unseen expanse of reality dhatu.

original: ci'i phyir yang rnam par rig pa tsam de la 'jug ce na zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang rnam par rig pa tsam de la 'jug ce na zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa 'dri ba ste /

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa'i rigs pa las de'i go rims smos pa ni byang bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa'i rigs pa las de'i go rims smos pa ni byang bar bya ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes gdul ba'i tshogs skal ba yod pa la phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The order of that is stated in order to make it clear that one should apply oneself in accordance with the teaching.üîΩThis is a benefit for the assembly of disciples who have good fortune.

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas theg pa chen po bstan pa'i chos thams cad bsdus te dmigs pa'o //

original: gzhan du na ni dus ring mo zhig tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar mi @247a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni dus ring mo zhig tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar mi @247a * //
translated: Otherwise, nonconceptual knowledge would not arise for a long time.

original: 'gyur ro // 'jig rten las 'das pa ni zag pa med pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // 'jig rten las 'das pa ni zag pa med pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supramundane because it is uncontaminated and nonconceptual.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes pa zhes bya ba ni de skad ces bya ba'i mnyam par gzhag pa phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi shes pa zhes bya ba ni de skad ces bya ba'i mnyam par gzhag pa phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pas so //

original: sna tshogs kyi rnam par rig pa'i shes pas zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po bla na yod pa dang / bla na med par rnam par 'jog pa ste /

analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i bag chags sgo bar byed pa dang bcas pa rnams te /

translated: The seed of the store-consciousness together with its signs refers to the latent impressions of the appearance of form, etc. together with their instigators.

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa'i sa bon rnams spangs pa bstan to //
translated: The abandonment of the seeds together with their causes and effects has been taught.

original: chos kyi sku la rig pa'i sa bon zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po mang du thos pa'i bag chags rnams te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku la rig pa'i sa bon zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po mang du thos pa'i bag chags rnams te /
translated: The seed of knowledge in the Dharma Body refers to the latent impressions of the Great Vehicle and much learning.

original: de ni chos kyi sku thob pa'i sngon du 'dren pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnas gyur nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rtog pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dri ma med par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de ni chos kyi sku thob pa'i sngon du 'dren pa'i phyir ro // gnas gyur nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rtog pas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dri ma med par 'byung ba'am /
translated: Because it is the forerunner to the attainment of the Dharma Body.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pas te /üîΩstobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pas te / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving been transformed‚Äù means that, due to the purity of suchness, mind and mental factors arise without defilement, or else, due to the purity of suchness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'grub pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'grub pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: all the qualities of a Buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, are achieved.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dri ma med cing thogs pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dri ma med cing thogs pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to attain the knowledge of an Omniscient One‚Äù means in order to attain stainless and unobstructed knowledge.

original: rjes la thob pa'i ye shes de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa thams cad rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: rjes la thob pa'i ye shes de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa thams cad rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat subsequently attained knowledge‚Äù and so forth. ‚ÄúAll the fundamental consciousnesses‚Äù are the causal ones.

original: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa rnams la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAll the representations of consciousness‚Äù are the resultant ones.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba rnams la phyin ci log dang nor ba med par rtog go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba rnams la phyin ci log dang nor ba med par rtog go //
translated: Because they see the other-dependent nature as it is, they do not conceive of the appearances of subject and object as erroneous or mistaken.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan ni de la glang po che la sogs pa med par mthong ba'i phyir rtsva la sogs pa sgyur ma'i rgyu rnams la phyin ci log med kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan ni de la glang po che la sogs pa med par mthong ba'i phyir rtsva la sogs pa sgyur ma'i rgyu rnams la phyin ci log med kyi /
translated: Because the magician sees the grass and so on as the causes of the illusion, not as an elephant and so on, he is not mistaken.

original: gzhan dag ni rtsva la sogs pa la glang po che la sogs par mthong ba'i phyir 'khrul pa de bzhin du de kho na mthong bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa mngon sum du byas nas langs pa na yang @247b
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rtsva la sogs pa la glang po che la sogs par mthong ba'i phyir 'khrul pa de bzhin du de kho na mthong bas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa mngon sum du byas nas langs pa na yang @247b
translated: But others, seeing the grass and so on as an elephant and so on, are mistaken. In the same way, having seen reality, having actualized the perfected nature, which is the absence of subject and object, when they rise from that meditative equipoise,

original: rjes la dag pas dag pa ston pa'i dus na chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu ston pa kun nas slong bar byed pa kun rdzob kyi shes pa dus thams cad du phyin ci ma log par gnas so //
analyzed: rjes la dag pas dag pa ston pa'i dus na chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu ston pa kun nas slong bar byed pa kun rdzob kyi shes pa dus thams cad du phyin ci ma log par gnas so //
translated: at the time of teaching the pure Dharma to others, the conventional knowledge that motivates the teaching of the causes and effects of phenomena always remains unmistaken.

original: nyan pa po dag ni phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: nyan pa po dag ni phyin ci log ste /
translated: The listeners are mistaken.

original: de dag kyang sems kyi rgyud la thos pa'i bag chags bsgos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang sems kyi rgyud la thos pa'i bag chags bsgos te /
translated: They also infuse the stream of consciousness with the latent impressions of hearing.

original: des bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir rim gyis khad kyis khad kyis phyin ci log med par 'gyur ro //üîΩrjes la thob pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: des bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir rim gyis khad kyis khad kyis phyin ci log med par 'gyur ro // rjes la thob pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa yang ma yin /
translated: By that, they gradually and slowly become non-mistaken, because it accomplishes its function.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The subsequent attainment is neither non-conceptual nor conceptual,

original: nyon mongs pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is afflicted.

original: de'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan pa'i gnas su rnam par mi rtog pa rjes dang dngos dang 'jug pa'i bye brag gis rnam par mi rtog pa rnam pa gsum du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa bstan pa'i gnas su rnam par mi rtog pa rjes dang dngos dang 'jug pa'i bye brag gis rnam par mi rtog pa rnam pa gsum du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in the section that teaches the training in superior wisdom, non-conceptuality is explained as threefold: non-conceptuality in terms of the actual basis, non-conceptuality in terms of the subsequent attainment, and non-conceptuality in terms of engagement.

original: mngon par rtogs pa thams cad la nges par 'byed ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa thams cad la nges par 'byed ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: All realizations arise as factors conducive to penetration.

original: de ni snga ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de dag bstan to //
analyzed: de ni snga ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de dag bstan to //
translated: They are taught because they have the nature of the former.

original: yongs su tshol ba bzhi po dag gis zhes bya ba ni ming dang don dang ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du brtags pa nges par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ji skad bstan pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba bzhi po dag gis zhes bya ba ni ming dang don dang ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du brtags pa nges par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ji skad bstan pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By means of the four investigations, i.e., by means of those which have been taught as having the nature of ascertainment, i.e., the investigation of the name, the object, the own-being and the particular.

original: don med par bzod pa chung ngu'i tshe zhes bya ba ni don med par bzod pa chung ngu'o //
analyzed: don med par bzod pa chung ngu'i tshe zhes bya ba ni don med par bzod pa chung ngu'o //
translated: At the time of the weak acquiescence in the non-production of things, i.e., at the time of the weak acquiescence in the non-production of things.

original: snang ba ni gsal ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba ni gsal ba ste /
translated: Appearance is clarity.

original: don med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: don med par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the non-existence of the object.

original: de 'dod pa'i phyir thob pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i phyir thob pa ste /
translated: It is obtained for the sake of that, i.e., for the sake of the appearance.

original: des na snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni snang ba thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni snang ba thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the concentration which obtains the appearance is called the concentration which obtains the appearance.

original: dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dro ba lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dro ba lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ste /
translated: The state of heat is the root of the wholesome which is like heat.

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las me 'byung bar 'gyur ba bzhin du de kho na shes pa'i me'i snga rol gyi yang rang bzhin gyi gnas rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las me 'byung bar 'gyur ba bzhin du de kho na shes pa'i me'i snga rol gyi yang rang bzhin gyi gnas rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as fire arises from the friction of the kindling wood, so too, prior to the fire of the knowledge of reality, there is the natural state which is called the cause.

original: nges par 'byed pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Penetration is clear knowledge.

original: de'i cha ni chos bdag med par bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i cha ni chos bdag med par bzod pa'o //
translated: Its portion is the acceptance of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de la phan pa dag ni de'i cha dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: de la phan pa dag ni de'i cha dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: The aids to that are the aids to penetration.

original: rtse mo ni dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mor phyin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po ming la sogs pa mi dmigs par nges pa gong du smos pa rnams la gnas pa ni ming la sogs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: rtse mo ni dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mor phyin pa'i phyir ro // yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po ming la sogs pa mi dmigs par nges pa gong du smos pa rnams la gnas pa ni ming la sogs pa ni rnam par rig pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The summit is so called because it is the limit of the fluctuation of the roots of virtue.üîΩThe stations of mindfulness are so called because they are the bases for the four knowledges of reality as it is, which were mentioned above, of the non-apprehension of name, etc.

original: don ni gang yang med do zhes bya bar nges par ni de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //üîΩgzung ba tsam gyi dngos po 'gog pa'i @248a * //
analyzed: don ni gang yang med do zhes bya bar nges par ni de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to // gzung ba tsam gyi dngos po 'gog pa'i @248a * //
translated: The concentration in which one enters into one part of the meaning of reality is the knowledge that name, etc. are mere representations,üîΩand that there is no object at all.

original: phyir phyogs gcig nyid de /
analyzed: phyir phyogs gcig nyid de /
translated: It is only a part because it negates the entity of the apprehended object alone.

original: 'di ltar don med par khong du chud pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar don med par khong du chud pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, one understands that there is no object,

original: rnam par rig pa tsam yang med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam yang med par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that there is no representation-only.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the stage of acquiescence in accordance with the truth.

original: rjes su mthun pa ni nye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ni nye ba'i phyir te /
translated: In accordance means in proximity,

original: des gzung ba med pa la brten nas 'dzin pa yang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gzung ba med pa la brten nas 'dzin pa yang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because on the basis of the non-apprehension of the grasped, one will realize the non-apprehension of the grasper.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di dag ni mngon par rtogs pa dang nye ba yin par zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na 'byung ba yin par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di dag ni mngon par rtogs pa dang nye ba yin par zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na 'byung ba yin par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: These meditative stabilizations are proximate to realization means that they occur at the time of realization.

original: ji ltar rnam par gnas pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rtags la sogs pa spros pa gang dang gang gis sa bcu par sa rnams bstan pa de dag la 'dres pa'i chos ma dmigs pa nyid ni 'dres par byas nas dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gnas pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rtags la sogs pa spros pa gang dang gang gis sa bcu par sa rnams bstan pa de dag la 'dres pa'i chos ma dmigs pa nyid ni 'dres par byas nas dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-apprehension of the mixed dharmas in the teaching of the stages, by whatever elaborations of general and particular characteristics, etc., is the mixing of the stages in the tenth stage, because they are apprehended by mixing.

original: gzhan du na tshogs bsags su zin kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na tshogs bsags su zin kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, even though the collections have been gathered, non-conceptual intuition would be impossible.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat transcends the world‚Äù means that it is nonconceptual.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa rnams par 'jog par byed pa dang / rjes la dag pas dag pa 'jig rten pas kyang de yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa rnams par 'jog par byed pa dang / rjes la dag pas dag pa 'jig rten pas kyang de yul du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is attained subsequently to that‚Äù means that it is attained subsequently to the nonconceptual wisdom. The phrase ‚Äúthat is purified subsequently to that‚Äù means that it is purified subsequently to the nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de gnas gyur nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang rjes la thob pa gnyis kyis gnas sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud rnam par dag nas te /
analyzed: de gnas gyur nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang rjes la thob pa gnyis kyis gnas sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyud rnam par dag nas te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is transformed‚Äù means that it is transformed by both the nonconceptual wisdom and the subsequently attained wisdom. The phrase ‚Äúthat is purified‚Äù means that the continuum of mind and mental factors is purified.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam pa gsum thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam pa gsum thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin order to attain the three bodies of a buddha‚Äù will be explained later.

original: khyad par gyi gnas skabs nas bcus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩdmigs pa'i khyad par ni theg pa chen po'i chos la byang chub sems dpa' thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab gsum gyis dmigs te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gnas skabs nas bcus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / dmigs pa'i khyad par ni theg pa chen po'i chos la byang chub sems dpa' thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab gsum gyis dmigs te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom the stage of special‚Äù refers to the stage of the eighth level of a bodhisattva.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe distinctive object‚Äù means that the bodhisattva‚Äôs wisdom that arises from hearing, etc., takes as its object the teachings of the Great Vehicle, not the teachings of the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i chos la ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe distinctive support‚Äù means that the bodhisattva‚Äôs wisdom that arises from hearing, etc., is supported by the perfection of wisdom, not by the perfection of meditative absorption.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa la sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang bzod pa la sbyor ba rnams so //

original: ye shes kyi tshogs ni thos pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs ni thos pa la sogs pa ste /

original: de dag bskal pa mi nyung bar bsags pa dag gis bstan nas khyad sar des byang chub dpa' la byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i stobs bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bskal pa mi nyung bar bsags pa dag gis bstan nas khyad sar des byang chub dpa' la byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i stobs bskyed pa'o //
translated: Having taught those for many eons, the bodhisattva generates the power of realization in the bodhisattva.

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par ni nyan thos ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam mngon par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par ni nyan thos ni gang zag la bdag med pa tsam mngon par rtogs par byed do //
translated: The difference in realization is that the ≈õrƒÅvaka realizes only the selflessness of the person.
