analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa mngon par rtogs par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva realizes the selflessness of the person and phenomena.

original: mya ngan @248b las 'das pa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan @248b las 'das pa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The difference in nirvƒÅ·πáa is that the bodhisattvas‚Äô nirvƒÅ·πáa is nonabiding.

original: shes rab dang snying rjes thabs kyis yongs su zin pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rjes thabs kyis yongs su zin pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not abide in the extremes of samsara and nirvana, due to the method of being completely taken hold of by wisdom and compassion.

original: nyan thos ni 'dus ma byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas so //
analyzed: nyan thos ni 'dus ma byas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas so //
translated: The sravaka abides in the nirvana that is uncompounded.

original: sa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bcu po dag gis nges par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bcu po dag gis nges par 'byung ngo //
translated: The distinction of stages is that the bodhisattva definitely emerges through the ten stages.

original: nyan thos rnams la ni sa rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la ni sa rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: The sravakas do not have the classification of stages.

original: yongs su dag pa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa yang bag chags dang bcas par spong la /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa yang bag chags dang bcas par spong la /
translated: The distinction of purification is that the bodhisattvas abandon the afflictions together with their imprints.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par dag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par dag go //
translated: And the buddha realm is purified to be the nature of gold and so on.

original: nyan thos rnams la ni bag chags dang bcas par spong ba yang med la /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la ni bag chags dang bcas par spong ba yang med la /
translated: The sravakas do not abandon the afflictions together with their imprints.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang med do //
translated: And there is no purification of the buddha realm.

original: bag chags zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med du zin kyang nyon mongs dang bcas pa bzhin du g-yo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med du zin kyang nyon mongs dang bcas pa bzhin du g-yo bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHabit energy‚Äù means that even though one is free from the passions, one acts as if one had them.

original: sems can thams cad dang bdag sems mnyam par nyid thob pa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang bdag sems mnyam par nyid thob pa'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod do //
translated: The difference in the equality of their thoughts of all beings and of themselves is that the bodhisattva, having attained the equality of self and others, does not cease to apply himself to the work of developing living beings.

original: nyan thos ni bdag dang gzhan tha dad du phye bas bdag gi don nyid la sbyor gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos ni bdag dang gzhan tha dad du phye bas bdag gi don nyid la sbyor gyi /
translated: The disciple, on the other hand, having divided self and other, applies himself to his own development,

original: gzhan gyi don la mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la mi sbyor ro //
translated: but not to the development of others.

original: skye ba'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs chos kyi dbyings su skyes nas sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs chos kyi dbyings su skyes nas sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
translated: The difference in their births is that the bodhisattva, born in the family of the TathƒÅgatas, becomes a Buddha,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs su skyes pa'i gzhon nu mtshan dang ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs su skyes pa'i gzhon nu mtshan dang ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: just as a prince born in the family of a universal monarch becomes a universal monarch.

original: nyan thos ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The disciple, on the other hand, is not like that.

original: ma rabs kyi rigs bran khol gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: ma rabs kyi rigs bran khol gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a slave of the lowest caste.

original: skye 'byung gi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni padma'i snying po la skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug par rdzus te skyes nas sangs rgyas nyid thob kyi bar du dus thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: skye 'byung gi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni padma'i snying po la skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug par rdzus te skyes nas sangs rgyas nyid thob kyi bar du dus thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su skye'o //
translated: The difference in the place of birth: the Bodhisattva is born miraculously, sitting cross-legged in the heart of a lotus, and is born in the circles of the retinue of the Tathagatas until he attains Buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings te /
translated: The circle of the retinue of the Buddha is the uncontaminated realm,

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul lo //
translated: the domain of the Buddha.

original: nyan thos ni ma'i mngal du skyes te phal pa bzhin no //üîΩ'bras bu'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu ni stobs la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs kyis brgyan pa lhun gyis grub par sems can gyi don byed nus pa chos kyi @249a * //
analyzed: nyan thos ni ma'i mngal du skyes te phal pa bzhin no // 'bras bu'i khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu ni stobs la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs kyis brgyan pa lhun gyis grub par sems can gyi don byed nus pa chos kyi @249a * //
translated: The Sravaka is born from the womb of a mother, like an ordinary person.

original: sku thob pa'o //
analyzed: sku thob pa'o //
translated: The difference in the fruit: the Bodhisattva attains the Dharma Body, which is adorned with the multitude of virtues such as the powers and is able to spontaneously accomplish the aims of sentient beings.

original: cig shos kyi 'bras bu ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos kyi 'bras bu ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i skye ba med pa'o //
translated: The fruit of the other is the non-existence of contaminated birth.

original: yongs su tshol ba dang de'i 'bras bu bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcas pa gnyis kyis sdud do //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba dang de'i 'bras bu bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcas pa gnyis kyis sdud do //
translated: Two verses summarizing the investigation and its result, the easy understanding of the result.

original: ming dang dngos gnyis phan tshun du //
analyzed: ming dang dngos gnyis phan tshun du //
translated: The name and the referent are mutually

original: glo bur yin par yongs su btsal //
analyzed: glo bur yin par yongs su btsal //
translated: accidental.

original: zhes bya ba ni ming la dngos po glo bur pa dang / dngos po la'ang ming glo bur ba zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ming la dngos po glo bur pa dang / dngos po la'ang ming glo bur ba zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The name is accidental to the referent, and the referent is accidental to the name.

original: ji ltar kha cig sgra dang don rtag tu 'brel ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig sgra dang don rtag tu 'brel ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not as some imagine that the word and the referent are always related, and that this is innate.

original: de tsam nyid du btsal bar bya /
analyzed: de tsam nyid du btsal bar bya /
translated: One should investigate to that extent.

original: yul gang du zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: btags pa rnams pa gnyis po la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: btags pa rnams pa gnyis po la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In the two kinds of designations.

original: ngo bo nyid du btags pa dang khyad par du btags pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du btags pa dang khyad par du btags pa'o //
translated: The designation of intrinsic identity and the designation of specific identity.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: 'di ni btags pa tsam ste tha snyad btags par zad kyi 'di la ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du btags pa ni med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni btags pa tsam ste tha snyad btags par zad kyi 'di la ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du btags pa ni med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is mere designation, for it is exhausted as a conventional designation. But there is no designation of own-being and of distinctions.

original: yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes pas //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes pas //
translated: By the perfect knowledge of reality as it is.

original: yongs su tshol ba bzhi po 'dis so //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba bzhi po 'dis so //
translated: By these four investigations.

original: don med par zhes bya ba ni don dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: don med par zhes bya ba ni don dang bral ba'o //
translated: Without an object means without a referent.

original: rtog gsum zhes bya ba ni ming du rtog pa dang / ngo bo nyid du btags par rtog pa dang / khyad par du btags par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog gsum zhes bya ba ni ming du rtog pa dang / ngo bo nyid du btags par rtog pa dang / khyad par du btags par rtog pa'o //
translated: The three concepts are the concept of name, the concept of the designation of intrinsic nature, and the concept of the designation of distinctions.

original: de med phyi zhes bya ba ni don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med phyi zhes bya ba ni don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-existence of these is the non-existence of the object.

original: don med par zhes bya ba ni rtog pa rnam pa gsum med par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: don med par zhes bya ba ni rtog pa rnam pa gsum med par mthong ba'o //
translated: Without an object means seeing the non-existence of the three kinds of concepts.

original: gsum la 'jug par yin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gsum la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gsum la 'jug par yin zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gsum la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The entry into the three means entry into the three natures.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i phyed kyis ni ming dang dngos po gnyis gcig la gcig glo bur yin par mthong nas kun btags pa'i ngo bo nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i phyed kyis ni ming dang dngos po gnyis gcig la gcig glo bur yin par mthong nas kun btags pa'i ngo bo nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The first half of the first verse shows that name and thing are seen as adventitious to each other, and that one enters into the imagined identity.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i phyed 'og mas ni ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du btags pa rtog pa tsam nyid du mthong nas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin no //üîΩtshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa rangs pas ni rtog par zad kyi /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang po'i phyed 'og mas ni ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du btags pa rtog pa tsam nyid du mthong nas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid mngon par rtogs pa yin no // tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa rangs pas ni rtog par zad kyi /
translated: The second half of the first verse shows that one realizes the relative identity by seeing that the imagined identity, as name and thing, is only imagination.

original: dngos par ni ma yin no zhes rtog pa rnams kyang med par mthong bas yongs su grub pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: dngos par ni ma yin no zhes rtog pa rnams kyang med par mthong bas yongs su grub pa la 'jug go //
translated: The second verse shows that one enters into the perfected identity by seeing that even the imagination does not exist, since it is only imagination, not things.

original: gzhan du na ni dag pa dang ma dag pa med pas bcings pa dang thar pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni dag pa dang ma dag pa med pas bcings pa dang thar pa mi 'grub po //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no bondage or liberation, since there would be no purity or impurity.

original: su zhig de ltar yongs su tshol nas 'bras bu thob pa dang su la de skad bstan pa de'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: su zhig de ltar yongs su tshol nas 'bras bu thob pa dang su la de skad bstan pa de'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Now, in order to show the result of the search and the one to whom it is taught, there is the verse

original: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pas //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pas //
translated: The Bodhisattva, in meditative equipoise,

original: gzugs brnyan yid du mthong ba ni //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yid du mthong ba ni //
translated: sees the reflection of the object in the mind,

original: @249b zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @249b zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: as if it were the object itself.

original: chos dang don du snang ba ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de nyid yin par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: chos dang don du snang ba ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs brnyan gang yin pa de nyid yin par mthong ba ste /
translated: The reflection of the object in concentration is the appearance of the object and of the word.

original: ji skad du rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pas rab tu phye ba can no /üîΩzhes ngas bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pas rab tu phye ba can no / zhes ngas bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is said that consciousness is distinguished by the perception of the object.

original: sus mthong zhe na byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par gzhag pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sus mthong zhe na byang chub sems dpa' mnyam par gzhag pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Who sees it? The Bodhisattva, in meditative equipoise.

original: sems rtse gcig pas so //üîΩdon gyi 'du shes bzlog nas su //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pas so // don gyi 'du shes bzlog nas su //
translated: With a one-pointed mind.üîΩHaving eliminated the notion of object,

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan de las don gyi 'du shes bsal nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs brnyan de las don gyi 'du shes bsal nas so //
translated: having eliminated the notion of object in that reflection,

original: rang gi 'du shes nges par gzung //
analyzed: rang gi 'du shes nges par gzung //
translated: he should grasp the notion of his own mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems 'di nyid chos dang don lta bur so sor snang ngo snyam du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems 'di nyid chos dang don lta bur so sor snang ngo snyam du'o //
translated: He should think, ‚ÄúThis very mind of mine in meditative equipoise appears as if it were the object and the word.‚Äù

original: de ltar nang du sems gnas so zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de'i sems nyid la sems gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgzung ba med par rab rtogs byos //
analyzed: de ltar nang du sems gnas so zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe de'i sems nyid la sems gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzung ba med par rab rtogs byos //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúthe mind abides internally‚Äù means that at that time, the mind itself abides in the mind.üîΩ‚ÄúOne should realize the nonexistence of the apprehended object.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med par shes par bya bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med par shes par bya bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the apprehended object does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa med rtogs kyis //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa med rtogs kyis //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, one should realize the nonexistence of the apprehending subject.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med na 'dzin pa ma 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba med na 'dzin pa ma 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the apprehended object does not exist, the apprehending subject is not tenable.üîΩ‚ÄúTherefore, one touches the objectless.‚Äù

original: des na dmigs pa med la reg / ces bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid dmigs pa dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid khong du chud de rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa med la reg / ces bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid dmigs pa dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid khong du chud de rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: One comprehends, one realizes suchness, which is free from the nature of both of them, i.e., the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum mo //
translated: The accumulation of merit consists of the three perfections beginning with generosity.üîΩThe accumulation of wisdom consists of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o / brtson 'grus ni gnyi gar gtogs so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o / brtson 'grus ni gnyi gar gtogs so //
translated: Vigor belongs to both.

original: bsam gtan ni tshad med pa la dmigs pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni tshad med pa la dmigs pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The meditative development of the immeasurables is the accumulation of merit.

original: gzhan ni ye shes kyi yan lag go //üîΩmtha' yas pha rol med ces bya ba ni mtha' yas shing pha rol med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni ye shes kyi yan lag go // mtha' yas pha rol med ces bya ba ni mtha' yas shing pha rol med pa ste /
translated: The other is the branch of intuition.üîΩEndless means without end, without limit.

original: mang ba dang rgyang ring ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: mang ba dang rgyang ring ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is endless because it is infinite, and it is limitless because it is immeasurable.

original: glu dbyangs dang sil snyan mtha' yas pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: glu dbyangs dang sil snyan mtha' yas pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the endlessness of song and music.

original: rgya mtsho pha mtha' med pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho pha mtha' med pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the endlessness of the ocean.

original: bsags te zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par byas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsags te zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par byas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Accumulated means fully completed.

original: chos la sems pa legs par rnam nges phyir //
analyzed: chos la sems pa legs par rnam nges phyir //
translated: Because of the thorough certainty of reflection on the teaching,

original: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes la mdo'i sde la sogs pa la shin tu nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes la mdo'i sde la sogs pa la shin tu nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: after the meditative concentration, there is thorough certainty about the scriptures, etc.

original: the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdon gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyus 'byung rtogs //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i phyir ro // don gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyus 'byung rtogs //
translated: Because of the absence of doubt.üîΩOne understands that the cause of the expression of meaning is mental expression.

original: zhes bya ba ni don rnams kyi rgyu ni yid kyi brjod pa yin par shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don rnams kyi rgyu ni yid kyi brjod pa yin par shes pa ste /
translated: One understands that the cause of the expression of meaning is mental expression.

original: ji skad du chos rnams brjod pa'i bag chags las byung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du chos rnams brjod pa'i bag chags las byung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said: ‚ÄúArising from the habitual tendencies to express phenomena. ‚Äù

original: rtog pa de yis bsgos pa yis //
analyzed: rtog pa de yis bsgos pa yis //
translated: And: ‚ÄúBy the impression of that thought,üîΩThe mind is turned away from the appearance of external objects. ‚Äù

original: rtog pa yid byed de'i gnas ni //
analyzed: rtog pa yid byed de'i gnas ni //
translated: And: ‚ÄúThe basis of that conceptual mental activity is the appearance of objects. ‚Äù

original: zhes @250a * //üîΩkyang bshad de /
analyzed: zhes @250a * // kyang bshad de /
translated: This is explained.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni tshogs kyi lam bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni tshogs kyi lam bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the path of accumulation.

original: de 'dra ba'i sems tsam nyid la gnas zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa la ste /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sems tsam nyid la gnas zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding in mere mind like that‚Äù is in the aspect of the object.

original: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du sems 'di nyid don gyi rnam par yongs su gyur to snyam du sems so //üîΩde bas gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bral ba yi ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du sems 'di nyid don gyi rnam par yongs su gyur to snyam du sems so // de bas gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bral ba yi ;
translated: Thus, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis very mind has transformed into the aspect of the object. ‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the dharmadhƒÅtu, free from the characteristics of duality,

original: / chos kyi dbyings ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: / chos kyi dbyings ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Is directly perceived.

original: zhes bya ba ni don med par rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sems tsam la gnas nas bzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don med par rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i sems tsam la gnas nas bzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du 'gyur te /
translated: Having previously realized the nonexistence of objects and then abiding in mere mind, one directly perceives the dharmadhƒÅtu, free from the duality of the characteristics of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: des par skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des par skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is born from that.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni sbyor ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni sbyor ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: This verse shows the path of application.

original: ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur pa de ltar ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum du 'gyur pa de ltar ston te /
translated: It shows how one comes to perceive reality.

original: sems las gzhan med par ni blos rtogs nas //
analyzed: sems las gzhan med par ni blos rtogs nas //
translated: The wise one, having understood that there is no object other than mind,

original: de phyir sems kyang med pa nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: de phyir sems kyang med pa nyid du rtogs //
translated: then understands that mind also does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems las gzhan pa dmigs par bya ba'i don med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems las gzhan pa dmigs par bya ba'i don med de /
translated: There is no object of operation other than mind.

original: de med pas dmigs par byed pa yang mi 'thad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de med pas dmigs par byed pa yang mi 'thad de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since that does not exist, the operation of the mind is not tenable.

original: blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wise one refers to one who possesses the excellence of wisdom.

original: gnyis po med rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni nges par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po med rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni nges par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having understood that both do not exist refers to the state of certainty.

original: de dang mi ldan chos kyi dbyings la gnas //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan chos kyi dbyings la gnas //
translated: He abides in the dharma-dhƒÅtu, which is not associated with either.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he is free from the grasped and the grasper.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: Abides means that he is situated there.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: This verse teaches the path of insight.

original: rtogs med shes stobs zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mthus so //
analyzed: rtogs med shes stobs zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mthus so //
translated: The power of knowledge without conceptualization refers to the power of nonconceptual intuition.

original: mnyam pa'i rjes song ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzung ba med pa de ltar 'dzin pa yang med do zhes mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song nas mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i rjes song ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gzung ba med pa de ltar 'dzin pa yang med do zhes mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song nas mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúhaving gone to the equality of the Dharma‚Äù means that, having gone to the equality of the Dharma, which is the equality of the nonexistence of the grasped and the grasper, he sees the Dharma of the scriptures, etc., as equal to space.

original: kun nas zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang nas so //
analyzed: kun nas zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang nas so //
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúin every way‚Äù means externally and internally.

original: rtag par yang zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag par yang zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúat all times‚Äù means at all times.

original: de'i gnas thibs po nyes pa bsags pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas thibs po nyes pa bsags pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag gi rgyu'o //
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúthe thicket of his abode, the accumulation of faults‚Äù refers to the cause of those afflicted phenomena.

original: thibs po ni shes par dka' zhing rtogs par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: thibs po ni shes par dka' zhing rtogs par dka' ba ste /
translated: The thicket is difficult to know and difficult to understand.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi bag chags kyi mdzod kun gzhi'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi bag chags kyi mdzod kun gzhi'o //
translated: The storehouse of the propensities for afflicted phenomena is the storeconsciousness.

original: rtsi sman chen pos dug ni sel ba bzhin //
analyzed: rtsi sman chen pos dug ni sel ba bzhin //
translated: Like a great medicinal plant, it removes poison.

original: zhes bya ba ni go sla bsam bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni go sla bsam bshad do //

analyzed: tshogs goms par byas pas yongs su smin pa'i shugs kyi mthus tshegs med par yang 'thob bo //
translated: And it is also attained without difficulty through the power of the maturity of the accumulations that have been cultivated.

original: de bas na tshigs su bcad pa gsum po 'di dag gis lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa rnam pa brgyad bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na tshigs su bcad pa gsum po 'di dag gis lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa rnam pa brgyad bshad do //
translated: Thus, these three verses explain the eight kinds of purity of superior attitude.

original: de dag grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid dang // go rims nges tshig goms bya yon tan dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i don gleng slong ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid dang // go rims nges tshig goms bya yon tan dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i don gleng slong ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚Äútheir number, their characteristics, their order, their definitions, their cultivation, their excellences‚Äù is a verse that introduces the topics that will be discussed below.

original: grangs rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: grangs rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the point of view of the establishment of their number,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe establishment of their resistances and counteragents, etc.‚Äù

original: rgyu gsum gyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug nyid de mi nyung mi mang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug nyid de mi nyung mi mang ngo //
translated: The perfections are six in number, neither more nor less.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa rnams kyis rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa rnams kyis rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The exposition of the adverse elements and their counteragents is as follows:

original: mi 'phags pa'i rgyu'i gnyen por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste //
analyzed: mi 'phags pa'i rgyu'i gnyen por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste //
translated: The perfections of generosity and morality are the counteragents to the causes of non-distinction.

original: zhes bya ba nas spags nas mi ldog pa'i chud za ba'i rgyu'i gnyen por bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //üîΩchud za ba'i rgyu ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab bo zhes bya ba la smad pa'i shes rab can rnams kyis phyin ci log tu bzung ba ni chud za ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas spags nas mi ldog pa'i chud za ba'i rgyu'i gnyen por bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar du'o // chud za ba'i rgyu ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab bo zhes bya ba la smad pa'i shes rab can rnams kyis phyin ci log tu bzung ba ni chud za ba ste /
translated: ... up to ... the perfections of meditation and wisdom are the counteragents to the causes of loss of what has been learnt.

original: mu stegs can bzhin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can bzhin no //
translated: The causes of loss are distraction and incorrect wisdom. Loss is the misapprehension of those who have incorrect wisdom, like the heterodox.

original: lhag ma ni go bar sla ste bshad pa nyid kyis legs par rnam par phye zin to //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar sla ste bshad pa nyid kyis legs par rnam par phye zin to //
translated: The rest is easily understood and has been well analysed by the commentary itself.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi'i gnas kyis zhes bya ba ni grangs rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi'i gnas kyis zhes bya ba ni grangs rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gnyis pa ste /
translated: The basis for the establishment of all the qualities of a buddha is the second reason for the arrangement of the number.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid de mi nyung mi mang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid de mi nyung mi mang ngo //
translated: The six perfections are not less than or more than that, because they are the cause of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhis pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi g-yeng ba gcig 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhis pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi g-yeng ba gcig 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-distraction of the perfections is accomplished by the four such as generosity, which are the cause of non-distraction. This is because there is no distraction, which is the opposing factor.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Non-distraction is the perfection of concentration.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba de la brten nas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid la brten nas so //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba de la brten nas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid la brten nas so //
translated: Based on that non-distraction means based on that very perfection of concentration.

original: chos kyi de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du mngon du yang dag par rtogs @252b pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa yang dag par 'grub ste /
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du mngon du yang dag par rtogs @252b pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa yang dag par 'grub ste /
translated: Because of the direct realization of the reality of things just as it is, means that by the perfection of wisdom which has thusness as its object, the qualities of the Buddha such as the powers are perfectly accomplished.

original: 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are accomplished.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun pas zhes bya ba ni grangs rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gsum pa'o ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun pas zhes bya ba ni grangs rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gsum pa'o ;
translated: By means of the three causes for the establishment of the number, i.e., by means of the three perfections, the bodhisattva benefits sentient beings.

original: ; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la phan 'dogs pa ni bde ba skyed pa'o //
analyzed: ; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la phan 'dogs pa ni bde ba skyed pa'o //
translated: The benefit of sentient beings by the perfection of generosity is the production of happiness.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa ni sdug bsngal mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa ni sdug bsngal mi skyed pa'o //
translated: The non-production of suffering for sentient beings by the perfection of morality is the non-production of suffering.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa ni mi mjed pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa ni mi mjed pa ste /
translated: The tolerance of harm by the perfection of patience is the non-aversion.

original: mi mjed na gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir gzhan la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: mi mjed na gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir gzhan la phan 'dogs so //
translated: By means of non-aversion, one benefits others because one does not harm them.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bya ba byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dag la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bya ba byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dag la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro // sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: By the perfection of effort, they become active in their performance of duties, because they benefit them and do not harm them.üîΩBy the perfection of meditation, they stabilize their minds, which are not yet stabilized.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: By the perfection of wisdom, they liberate their minds, which are already stabilized.

original: gdams par bya ba rnams zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag gi yul du gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: gdams par bya ba rnams zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag gi yul du gyur pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are to be instructed are the objects of instruction.

original: yongs su smin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin par bya ba'i yul du 'gyur ba'o //üîΩmtshan nyid kyi skabs kyis /
analyzed: yongs su smin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin par bya ba'i yul du 'gyur ba'o // mtshan nyid kyi skabs kyis /
translated: They become ripe means they become objects to be ripened.

original: dam pa drug gis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa drug gis blta bar bya ste /
translated: The six topics are to be understood by means of the six perfections.üîΩThe six topics are the best, the object, the cause, the result, the action, and the endowment.

original: gnas dam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩre re la yang dam pa drug ste /
analyzed: gnas dam pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩre re la yang dam pa drug ste /
translated: The best is twofold:

original: phal cher ni bshad pa nyid kyis rnam par bkrol bas go bar bla'o //
analyzed: phal cher ni bshad pa nyid kyis rnam par bkrol bas go bar bla'o //
translated: Most of the rest can be understood through the explanation itself.

original: des na chung zad tsam zhig rnam par dgrol lo //
analyzed: des na chung zad tsam zhig rnam par dgrol lo //
translated: Therefore, only a small portion will be clarified.

original: mtha' dag kun du spyod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mtha' dag kun du spyod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the practice of the totality,

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnam pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnam pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means because of the total giving of all internal and external things.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin par byed pa dang / len pa la rnam par rtog par mi byed pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin par byed pa dang / len pa la rnam par rtog par mi byed pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Because of the possession of nonconceptual intuition means that, because of the absence of conceptual differentiation of the gift, the giver, and the receiver, there is the purity of the three sectors.

original: lhag ma ni go sla bas ma bshad do //üîΩsbyin pa yin la pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa 'ang yod ces bya ba ni dam pa drug dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla bas ma bshad do // sbyin pa yin la pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa 'ang yod ces bya ba ni dam pa drug dang bral ba'o //
translated: The rest is self evident and therefore need not be explained.üîΩGiving that is not a perfection exists means giving that is not endowed with the six noble factors.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yin la sbyin pa ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni dam pa drug dang ldan pa'i @253a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yin la sbyin pa ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni dam pa drug dang ldan pa'i @253a * //
translated: A perfection that is not giving exists means the other five perfections that are endowed with the six noble factors.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: morality, etc.

original: sbyin pa yang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin pa 'ang yod ces bya ba ni dam pa drug dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin pa 'ang yod ces bya ba ni dam pa drug dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: There is giving which is also a perfection, i.e., giving endowed with the six excellences.

original: sbyin pa yang ma yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni dam pa drug dang bral ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang ma yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba ni dam pa drug dang bral ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: There is morality, etc., which is neither giving nor a perfection, i.e., morality, etc., not endowed with the six excellences.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa la mu bzhi yod pa de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan lnga po dag la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa la mu bzhi yod pa de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan lnga po dag la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as there are four alternatives for giving, so there are for the other five perfections, as is appropriate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩbse ru lta bu rnams la ni //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / bse ru lta bu rnams la ni //
translated: For this very reason,üîΩit is said:

original: pha rol tu phyin drug ming yang med //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin drug ming yang med //
translated: The rhinoceroses do not even have the name of the six perfections.

original: bcom ldan nyag gcig pha rol tu phyin //üîΩdrug gi spyi la bzhugs pa lags //
analyzed: bcom ldan nyag gcig pha rol tu phyin // drug gi spyi la bzhugs pa lags //
translated: The Blessed One alone is the one who has gone to the other side,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: and he is the one who dwells in the generality of the six perfections.

original: de'i phyi ma 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyi ma 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in conformity with the future.

original: zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rnams la ma chags na tshul khrims srung nus so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rnams la ma chags na tshul khrims srung nus so //
translated: Thus, if one is not attached to enjoyments, one is able to guard morality.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan na bzod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan na bzod do //
translated: If one has morality, one is patient.

original: bzod na mi mthun pa la mi mjed pas brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: bzod na mi mthun pa la mi mjed pas brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: If one is patient, one is not hostile to adversaries, and so one undertakes effort.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: If one undertakes effort, one stabilizes the mind in meditative concentration.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: If one stabilizes the mind in meditative concentration, one knows things as they really are.

original: go rims kyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: go rims kyi dgos pa'o //
translated: This is the purpose of the sequence.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad las phul du byung bar pha rol du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gi spyi'i nges pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad las phul du byung bar pha rol du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gi spyi'i nges pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúperfection‚Äù is used because they transcend all the mundane and supramundane roots of virtue, such as the generosity of the disciples and hermit buddhas. This is the general etymological definition of the term.

original: 'dir phul gyi tshig gi don ni pha rol la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir phul gyi tshig gi don ni pha rol la bya'o //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúperfection‚Äù is to be understood as ‚Äúthe other shore.‚Äù

analyzed: ser sna dang dbul ba 'joms pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni so so'i bye brag gi nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúperfection‚Äù is used because they conquer stinginess, poverty, and so on. This is the specific etymological definition of each term.

original: de la ser sna dang dbul ba 'joms zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de la ser sna dang dbul ba 'joms zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase destroying stinginess and poverty refers to the time of the cause.

original: longs spyod chen po dang bsod nams kyi tshogs thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po dang bsod nams kyi tshogs thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase obtaining the accumulation of great resources and merit refers to the time of the effect.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / ngan 'gro zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / ngan 'gro zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase pacifying immorality and bad rebirths refers to the time of the cause.

original: bde 'gro dang ting nge 'dzin 'thob par byed bzhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ting nge 'dzin 'thob par byed bzhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase obtaining good rebirths and meditative concentration refers to the time of the effect.

original: khro ba ni zhe sdang mngon du gyur ba ste /
analyzed: khro ba ni zhe sdang mngon du gyur ba ste /
translated: Anger is the manifestation of hatred.

original: 'phral du gnod pa byed pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'phral du gnod pa byed pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: It is the basis for immediately doing harm.

original: 'khon pa ni mdud par 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: 'khon pa ni mdud par 'dzin pa ste //
translated: Bearing a grudge is the holding on to resentment.

original: zhes sdang mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes sdang mi 'dor ba'o //

original: de gnyi ga zad par byed pa ni rgyu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga zad par byed pa ni rgyu'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase destroying both of these refers to the time of the cause.

original: bdag dang gzhan la bde bar byed pa ni 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la bde bar byed pa ni 'bras bu'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase bringing happiness to oneself and others refers to the time of the effect.

original: nges pa'i tshig 'og ma rnams la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig 'og ma rnams la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood for the remaining etymologies.

original: bshad pa nyid kyis legs par rnam par phye zin to //
analyzed: bshad pa nyid kyis legs par rnam par phye zin to //
translated: This has been well analyzed by the explanation itself.

original: @253b bsgom pa ni goms par bya ba ste lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: @253b bsgom pa ni goms par bya ba ste lhur len pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the repeated practice of the virtues.

original: kun du spyod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa lngar dbye'o //üîΩkun du spyod pa la sbyor ba bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la legs par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: kun du spyod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa lngar dbye'o // kun du spyod pa la sbyor ba bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la legs par 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is divided into five types according to the distinctions of practice, etc.üîΩPractice is the application to the practice of generosity, etc.

original: dad sogs sbyin phod khyad par 'phags //üîΩzhes bya ba dang / bsti stang byas nas dus su lag dar te //
analyzed: dad sogs sbyin phod khyad par 'phags // zhes bya ba dang / bsti stang byas nas dus su lag dar te //
translated: Faith, etc., are the special excellences of the giver.üîΩAs it is said, ‚ÄúHaving honored them, at the proper time, with one‚Äôs own hands, one should give‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: sbyin zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩyang ji skad du /
analyzed: sbyin zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o // yang ji skad du /

analyzed: nus pa chung yang gzhan phan sbyor // rnam pa kun du gtang mi bya // gnas skabs kun du nus mthun par // sems can rnams la phan gdags so //

analyzed: gsum pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir te /

original: bsam gtan byas na mu ge dang nad kyi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan byas na mu ge dang nad kyi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one practices meditation, famine, disease, and fear are pacified.

original: rnam par mi rtog par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni rnam par mi rtog par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni rnam par mi rtog par sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application to non-imagination is the equipment for the non-imagination,

original: de'i tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the non-imagination.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: The non-imagination is the actual first concentration.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mthu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mthu las byung ba ste /
translated: The subsequent attainment arises from the power of realization.

original: kun rdzob shes pa'i bdag nyid can chos ston pa kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa'i bdag nyid can chos ston pa kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: It is the motivation of the teaching of the Dharma, which has the nature of conventional knowledge.

original: 'di dag bsdus par ji ltar ba lta zhe na zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di dag bsdus par ji ltar ba lta zhe na zhes brjod pa /
translated: How are these included?

original: 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that these three virtues include all virtues,

original: bstan pa bzhin ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa bzhin ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not practiced as taught.

original: 'di ni nyes pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa ma yin te ;
translated: This is not a fault.

original: gal te 'di dag gis dge pa'i chos thams cad bsdus na don du dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis kyang 'di dag bsdus par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag gis dge pa'i chos thams cad bsdus na don du dge ba'i chos thams cad kyis kyang 'di dag bsdus par bstan pa yin no //
translated: If these three virtues include all virtues, then in fact all virtues are included in these three.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad ni gsum ste /
translated: All virtues are of three kinds:

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nas stobs la thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa nas stobs la thug pa rnams so //
translated: generosity and so on, faith and so on, and the applications of mindfulness and so on up to the powers.

original: de la de'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la de'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: Among them, those included by their own characteristics are generosity and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pas dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i sa mang po pa sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i sems 'byung ba rnams ni de dang mthun pas bsdus te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pas dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i sa mang po pa sbyin pa la sogs pa dge ba'i sems 'byung ba rnams ni de dang mthun pas bsdus te /
translated: Faith and so on, which are virtuous mental factors that occur in a virtuous mind, are included by generosity and so on because they are compatible with them.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan na phyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan na phyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one possesses faith and so on, one engages in the perfections and so on.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa dang / stobs la sogs pa ni de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams dang / nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa dang / stobs la sogs pa ni de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa ste /
translated: The factors of enlightenment, the absence of conflict and so on, and the powers and so on are subsumed as the result of that,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the result of the perfections.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sa dang pha rol phyin pa ni //
analyzed: sa dang pha rol phyin pa ni //
translated: The levels and perfections

original: sangs rgyas chos kyi @255b gnas yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos kyi @255b gnas yin no //
translated: are the basis of the Buddha's qualities.

original: gnas gyur pa ni 'bras bu ste //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni 'bras bu ste //
translated: The transformation is the result

original: chos kyi sku zhes brjod pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes brjod pa yin // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: and is called the dharmakaya.

original: 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab rnams kyis /
analyzed: 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal pa'i shes rab rnams kyis /
translated: As for the antitheses of these perfections, they are stinginess, immorality, anger, laziness, distraction and faulty wisdom.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ji ltar bsdus par blta zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ji ltar bsdus par blta zhe na /
translated: How should one view the inclusion of all the defilements by these?

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ser sna la sogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ser sna la sogs pa nyid de /
translated: The phrase by their very nature means that they are included in the essential nature of stinginess, etc.,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: because they are devoid of any substance that is other than that.

original: de'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni ma dad pa la sogs pa nas log par lta ba la thug pa rnams te /
analyzed: de'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni ma dad pa la sogs pa nas log par lta ba la thug pa rnams te /
translated: The phrase their basis refers to lack of faith, etc., up to wrong views,

original: ser sna la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of stinginess, etc.

original: de'i 'bras bus zhes bya ba ni g-yo la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bus zhes bya ba ni g-yo la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase their result refers to deceit, etc.,

original: ser sna la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the result of stinginess, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas /üîΩdbang phyug bsdus pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i phan yon nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas / dbang phyug bsdus pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i phan yon nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhing /
translated: The benefits of the perfections are now described.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
translated: The phrase the collection of lordly powers refers to the benefits of the perfection of generosity, which are not subject to affliction and are free of misfortune.

original: phan yon mngon par mtho ba kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phan yon mngon par mtho ba kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase the benefit of high status that is free of misfortune should be applied to all the perfections.

original: chen por skye ba bsdus pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: chen por skye ba bsdus pa ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of morality is included in the great birth,

original: bde 'gro yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of happy rebirth.

original: phyogs dang g-yog 'khor chen po bsdus pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs dang g-yog 'khor chen po bsdus pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of patience is included in the great retinue and the great following,

original: phyogs ni nye du'i tshogs so //
analyzed: phyogs ni nye du'i tshogs so //
translated: because the retinue is the group of relatives,

original: g-yog 'khor ni bran pho dang bran mo la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor ni bran pho dang bran mo la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
translated: and the following is the group of servants, maids, and so on.

original: las kyi mtha' chen po la sbyor ba 'grub pas yongs su bzung ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' chen po la sbyor ba 'grub pas yongs su bzung ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of effort is included in the great application to action and the great success,

original: las kyi mtha' chen po'i mtha' ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' chen po'i mtha' ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la sogs pa'o //
translated: because the great application to action is the great success in the wheel-turning king's sovereignty, and so on.

original: de dag la sbyor ba ni rab tu 'bad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la sbyor ba ni rab tu 'bad pa'o //
translated: Application to that is the great effort.

original: de 'grub pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de 'grub pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: Success is the great success.

original: des yongs su bzung ba ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des yongs su bzung ba ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is included in that because it is unobstructed.

original: gnod pa med pa dang nyon mongs pa chung ba'i sa bon yongs su bzung ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa dang nyon mongs pa chung ba'i sa bon yongs su bzung ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of meditation is the retention of the seed of non-injury and of little defilement.

original: bsam gtan gyis de'i mthu 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis de'i mthu 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For by meditation one destroys their power.üîΩThe retention of skill in all the arts, treatises, and sciences, which is not reprehensible and is not a source of regret, is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is not like the wisdom of the mundane which is reprehensible and a source of regret.

original: bzo dang bstan bcos dang rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa yongs su bzung ba mngon par ma tho ba kha na ma tho ba med pa ni 'jig rten ba'i mngon par ma tho ba ltar kha na ma tho ba ltar kha na ma tho ba dang
analyzed: bzo dang bstan bcos dang rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa yongs su bzung ba mngon par ma tho ba kha na ma tho ba med pa ni 'jig rten ba'i mngon par ma tho ba ltar kha na ma tho ba ltar kha na ma tho ba dang
translated: And it is not interrupted at any time.üîΩWhat is it then?üîΩIt is the retention of skill in all the arts, treatises, and sciences, which is not reprehensible and is not a source of regret, is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is not like the wisdom of the mundane which is reprehensible and a source of regret.

original: bcas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: And it is not interrupted at any time.üîΩWhat is it then?üîΩIt is the retention of skill in all the arts, treatises, and sciences, which is not reprehensible and is not a source of regret, is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is not like the wisdom of the mundane which is reprehensible and a source of regret.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa yin yang dus yongs @256a * //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa yin yang dus yongs @256a * //
translated: And it is not interrupted at any time.üîΩWhat is it then?üîΩIt is the retention of skill in all the arts, treatises, and sciences, which is not reprehensible and is not a source of regret, is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is not like the wisdom of the mundane which is reprehensible and a source of regret.

original: su chad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: su chad pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not interrupted at any time.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du'o //
translated: It is the retention of skill in all the arts, treatises, and sciences, which is not reprehensible and is not a source of regret, is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bdag gi don byed pa lta bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi bdag gi don byed pa lta bu yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the wisdom of the mundane which is reprehensible and a source of regret.üîΩAnd it is not interrupted at any time.

original: 'o na ci zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na //
translated: What is it then?

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar nye bar gnas pa ste /
translated: It is the retention of skill in all the arts, treatises, and sciences, which is not reprehensible and is not a source of regret, is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is not like the wisdom of the mundane which is reprehensible and a source of regret.üîΩAnd it is not interrupted at any time.üîΩWhat is it then?üîΩIt is the retention of skill in all the arts, treatises, and sciences, which is not reprehensible and is not a source of regret, is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is not like the wisdom of the mundane which is reprehensible and a source

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad re re la yang mngon par mtho ba'i khyad par 'di bzhin du brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad re re la yang mngon par mtho ba'i khyad par 'di bzhin du brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: This is the special excellence of the high rebirth that is to be expressed for each of the perfections.üîΩIn some places, it is taught by the word ‚Äúgenerosity,‚Äù

original: la lar ni sbyin pa'i sgrar bstan ces bya ba ni rdo rje gcod pa la sogs pa'i mdo dag las gcig bstan gyi /
analyzed: la lar ni sbyin pa'i sgrar bstan ces bya ba ni rdo rje gcod pa la sogs pa'i mdo dag las gcig bstan gyi /
translated: in the Diamond Cutter Sutra and so on, but not all the perfections are taught.

original: thams cad ma bstan pa de ci las dgongs zhes lde ma por dgongs 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ma bstan pa de ci las dgongs zhes lde ma por dgongs 'dri ba'o //
translated: What is the intention behind that?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la sbyor ba ni 'di dag thams cad kyi spyod pa 'gro ba las lde ma por dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la sbyor ba ni 'di dag thams cad kyi spyod pa 'gro ba las lde ma por dgongs pa ste /
translated: The application to all the perfections is the intention behind that.

original: 'di ltar sngo ma pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / spro ba dang ldan pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa dang / las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa rig pa dang ldan pa sbyin pa la 'jig gi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngo ma pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / spro ba dang ldan pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa dang / las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa rig pa dang ldan pa sbyin pa la 'jig gi /
translated: Thus, one who is not miserly, who is patient, who is enthusiastic, who has a one-pointed mind, and who knows the connection between actions and their results practices generosity,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: de bzhin du ser sna dang / khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / log par lta ba spangs pa tshul khrims la 'jug gi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ser sna dang / khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / log par lta ba spangs pa tshul khrims la 'jug gi /
translated: Likewise, one should understand that the morality of the bodhisattva is the avoidance of stinginess, ill-will, laziness, distraction, and false views.

original: gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other perfections.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again it is said:

original: sbyin 'dod nyid kyis chags pa sel bar byed /üîΩbyams pas zhe sdang gus byin nga rgyal te //
analyzed: sbyin 'dod nyid kyis chags pa sel bar byed / byams pas zhe sdang gus byin nga rgyal te //
translated: The desire to give removes attachment.üîΩLove removes hatred, respect removes arrogance,

original: phrag dog ldan pa slong la bde 'dod pas /
analyzed: phrag dog ldan pa slong la bde 'dod pas /
translated: and the desire to give to the supplicant removes envy.

original: med can byin pa yod par lta bas sel //
analyzed: med can byin pa yod par lta bas sel //
translated: The gift of the non-possessor removes the view of the possessor.

original: zhe'o // yang ji skad du /
analyzed: zhe'o // yang ji skad du /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs tshul du rnam par 'byed pa na //
analyzed: chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs tshul du rnam par 'byed pa na //
translated: When one discriminates the gift, the giver, and the recipient,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag ni sbyin pa'i bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag ni sbyin pa'i bdag nyid yin //
translated: the six perfections are the nature of giving.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: This has been explained.

original: shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu bstan pa bshad zin te //
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu bstan pa bshad zin te //
translated: The cause and result of the engagement with the characteristics of the knowable have been explained.

original: shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag ci rigs su mthong ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gti mug spang ba'i phyir bsgom par bya bas na de bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byed do //üîΩsa bcu rnams su zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / sdom pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang / bden pa la lta ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so so rtog pa @256b dang ;
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag ci rigs su mthong ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gti mug spang ba'i phyir bsgom par bya bas na de bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byed do // sa bcu rnams su zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa dang / sdom pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang / bden pa la lta ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la so so rtog pa @256b dang ;
translated: These perfections are the cause and effect of the entry into the characteristics of the knowable. They are to be seen and cultivated in the appropriate order, and they are cultivated in order to eliminate the delusion that is to be eliminated by seeing and cultivation.üîΩThe ten stages are the stages of the bodhisattvas, namely, the stages of Joyful, Stainless, Luminous, Radiant, Difficult to Conquer, Manifest, Gone Far, Immovable, Excellent Wisdom, and Cloud of Dharma.

original: rtsol ba dang bcas pa dang / lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / nyon mongs pa 'di dag tu sel bas nas rnams so //
analyzed: rtsol ba dang bcas pa dang / lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med par gnas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / nyon mongs pa 'di dag tu sel bas nas rnams so //
translated: The ten stages are so called because the bodhisattvas eliminate the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions on these stages, namely, the realization of the bodhisattvas, the vows, the freedom from attachment, the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment, the view of the truths, the discernment of dependent origination,üîΩthe effortless and spontaneous dwelling in signlessness, the correct individual awareness, and the consecration.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcur yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcur yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu should be understood in terms of ten aspects, such as all-pervading.

original: rnam pa bcu po de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa rnam pa bcu nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa rnam pa bcu nyid de /
translated: The ten aspects are the ten kinds of nescience that are their opposites.

original: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su shes pa rnams bcu'o //
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su shes pa rnams bcu'o //
translated: The ten kinds of thorough understanding are for the sake of eliminating those.

original: de yongs su shes pas sa bcu dag la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de yongs su shes pas sa bcu dag la 'jug ste /
translated: Through thorough understanding of them, one enters the ten stages.

original: chos bdag med pa shes pa'i gnas skabs ni sa rnams so //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa shes pa'i gnas skabs ni sa rnams so //
translated: The stages are the occasions of the knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sa dang po la ni kun du 'gro ba'i don du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sa dang po la ni kun du 'gro ba'i don du shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: On the first stage, one should understand it in terms of all-pervading.

original: chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir gang mi stong pa'i chos de med do zhes de ltar sa dang po la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir gang mi stong pa'i chos de med do zhes de ltar sa dang po la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus one enters the first stage, because all phenomena are empty, and there is no phenomenon that is not empty.

original: gnyis pa la ni mchog gi don du ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni mchog gi don du ste /
translated: On the second stage, it is in terms of the supreme.

original: 'di ni chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pas dper na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mchog ces gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di ni chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pas dper na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mchog ces gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Since this is the supreme of all phenomena, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúThe supreme of those free from desire.‚Äù

original: de ltar sa gnyis pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sa gnyis pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus one enters the second stage.

original: gsum pa la ni rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog tu ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog tu ste /
translated: On the third, they are the supreme object of natural outcome.

original: bstan pa'i chos ni 'di'i rgyu mthun pa'i mchog go zhes gsum pa la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos ni 'di'i rgyu mthun pa'i mchog go zhes gsum pa la zhugs pa ste /
translated: The Dharma of teaching is the supreme natural outcome of this.

original: 'di ltar legs par gsungs pa gcig gi don du yang bdag nyid yongs su 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar legs par gsungs pa gcig gi don du yang bdag nyid yongs su 'dor ro //
translated: Thus, they enter the third stage, since they give up their own bodies for the sake of a single well spoken verse.

original: bzhi pa la ni yongs bzung ba ma yin pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yongs bzung ba ma yin pa'i don du ste /
translated: On the fourth, they are the object of non appropriation.

original: 'di ni bdag gam gzhan gang gi yongs su bzung ba yang ma yin no zhes bdag gi med pas bzhi pa la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gam gzhan gang gi yongs su bzung ba yang ma yin no zhes bdag gi med pas bzhi pa la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: They enter the fourth stage, since they think, This is not appropriated by anyone, either myself or another.

original: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la sred pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos la sred pa rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do this in order to stop craving for the Dharma of the scriptures, etc.

original: lnga pa la ni rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i don du ste /
translated: On the fifth, they are the object of non differentiation of continua.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rgyud tha dad pa ltar 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes lnga pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa rgyud tha dad pa ltar 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes lnga pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: They enter the fifth stage, since they think, This is not like form, etc., which are differentiated in their continua.

original: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ma yin pa'i don du ste /
translated: On the sixth, they are the object of non affliction and non purification.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin na rnam par dag par yang lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin na rnam par dag par yang lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: If it is not naturally defiled, how could it be purified?

original: rnam par byang ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes drug pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes drug pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Because purification is preceded by defilement.

original: bdun pa la ni chos sna tshogs tha dad pa med pa'i don du ste /
analyzed: bdun pa la ni chos sna tshogs tha dad pa med pa'i don du ste /
translated: On the seventh stage, the meaning of the non-differentiation of the variety of phenomena is entered into.

original: ji ltar mdo'i sde la sogs pa chos 'di dag sna tshogs pa ltar 'di ni de lta ma @257a * //üîΩyin no zhes bdun pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo'i sde la sogs pa chos 'di dag sna tshogs pa ltar 'di ni de lta ma @257a * // yin no zhes bdun pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Just as these phenomena, the scriptural divisions of Sutra and so on, are a variety, this is not so.

original: brgyad pa la ni bri ba med cing lhag pa med pa'i don zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni bri ba med cing lhag pa med pa'i don zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the eighth stage, the meaning of non-decrease and non-increase is entered into.

original: bri ba med pa ni chos thams cad du chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bri ba med pa ni chos thams cad du chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-decrease is because all phenomena are not cut off.

original: lhag pa med pa ni chos la lhag par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa med pa ni chos la lhag par gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-increase is because there is no abiding in the remainder of phenomena.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bri ba na 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang ba 'phel ban 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa 'bri ba na 'bri bar mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang ba 'phel ban 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or else, when the defilements are reduced, they are not reduced; and when purification increases, it does not increase.üîΩHe penetrates the dharmadhatu as the basis of mastery over the sign and the basis of mastery over the field.üîΩHe obtains it as he wishes, just as it is.üîΩHe obtains it as he wishes, just as it is.üîΩHe obtains it as he wishes, just as it is.

original: mtshan ma la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don dang / zhing la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du chos kyi dbyings su brgyad pa nyid la rtogs te /
analyzed: mtshan ma la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don dang / zhing la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du chos kyi dbyings su brgyad pa nyid la rtogs te /
translated: He obtains it as he wishes, just as it is.üîΩHe obtains it as he wishes, just as it is.

original: de thob pa ni ji lta bur gang 'dod pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de thob pa ni ji lta bur gang 'dod pa 'thob bo //
translated: He obtains it as he wishes, just as it is.üîΩHe obtains it as he wishes, just as it is.

original: de thob pa ni zhing gser las grub pa pa'am gzhan ji lta bur mos pa de bzhin du snang ngo //üîΩsa gong ma rnams la ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa bsgrims te bsgrubs pa yod do //üîΩsa brgyad pa ni lhun gyis grub pas 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa'i phyir te /
