original: de ltar sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa yin no //üîΩdgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du ste /
analyzed: de ltar sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa yin no //üîΩdgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du ste /
translated: He obtains it as he wishes, just as it is.üîΩHe obtains it as he

original: de la brten nas so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, on the basis of that, one attains the correct and discerning awareness.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang thob pas chos thams cad la sgra ji bzhin ma yin par dgongs pa'i don shes te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang thob pas chos thams cad la sgra ji bzhin ma yin par dgongs pa'i don shes te /
translated: And because one has attained the perfection of the aggregate of wisdom, one knows the meaning of the non-literal intention with regard to all the teachings.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa so sor myong ba'i phyir de ltar dgu pa la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa so sor myong ba'i phyir de ltar dgu pa la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one is engaged in the ninth stage, in order to experience the full enjoyment of the teachings and to bring beings to full maturity, just as they are.

original: bcu pa la ni las la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don dang / gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du ste /
analyzed: bcu pa la ni las la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don dang / gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du ste /
translated: In the tenth stage, one is engaged in the object of mastery over action and the object of mastery over the doors of concentration and retention.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du lus dang / dag dang yid kyi las thob ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du lus dang / dag dang yid kyi las thob ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one attains mastery over the actions of body, speech, and mind, just as one wishes.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga po dag gis rang rang gi las ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga po dag gis rang rang gi las ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one accomplishes one's own actions just as one wishes, through the five superknowledges.

original: gzungs ni gang gi tshig dang don la sogs pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs ni gang gi tshig dang don la sogs pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Retention is that by which one retains the words and meanings, etc.

original: dbang ni de la dbang ba'am des dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: dbang ni de la dbang ba'am des dbang byed pa ste /
translated: Mastery is the mastery of that or the control of that.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thams cad kyi tshig dang don 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa thams cad kyi tshig dang don 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of retaining the words and meanings of all that is taught by the Buddha.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa spangs pas ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa spangs pas ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of the door of samadhi is for the sake of entering into the samadhis such as the sky treasury, just as one wishes, by abandoning the obscurations to all meditative attainments.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni dbang 'di gnyis kyi gnas kyi don dus bcu pa @257b la rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni dbang 'di gnyis kyi gnas kyi don dus bcu pa @257b la rab tu rtogs so //
translated: The realm of Dharma is fully understood in the tenth stage for the sake of the basis of these two masteries.

original: ma rig pa 'di yang nyan thos rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di yang nyan thos rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This ignorance is not afflicted for sravakas, because it is not to be abandoned.

original: de mi spong ba ni de'i gnyen po'i sa la 'jug pa'i skabs ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bgegs mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi spong ba ni de'i gnyen po'i sa la 'jug pa'i skabs ma yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bgegs mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not abandoned because it is not the occasion for entering the stage that is its antidote and because it does not obstruct nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can te zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can te zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas' is afflicted, because it is to be abandoned.

original: spong ba ni de'i gnyen po'i sa la 'jug pa'i skabs yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong ba ni de'i gnyen po'i sa la 'jug pa'i skabs yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandonment is the occasion for engaging the stage that is the antidote to that, and because it obstructs omniscience.

original: sa dang po la 'jug pa nyid na chos kyi dbyings ni rnam pa thams cad rab tu thob pa yin na gong nas gong du rnam pa ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
analyzed: sa dang po la 'jug pa nyid na chos kyi dbyings ni rnam pa thams cad rab tu thob pa yin na gong nas gong du rnam pa ci'i phyir brjod ce na /
translated: When one enters the first stage, one obtains the realm of the Dharma in all its aspects. Why is it said to have aspects that are progressively higher?

original: chos kyi dbyings thob nas gnas pa'i rnam pa'i dag gis gnas te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thob nas gnas pa'i rnam pa'i dag gis gnas te /
translated: Having obtained the realm of the Dharma, one abides in it by means of the aspects of abiding.

original: thob pa tsam gyis chos par 'dzin cing gi na 'jug pa ma yin par ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhes gnas pa'i kun du spyod pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa tsam gyis chos par 'dzin cing gi na 'jug pa ma yin par ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhes gnas pa'i kun du spyod pa yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it known that one does not enter the Dharma merely by obtaining it? In order to demonstrate the conduct of abiding.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the reason for engaging the term,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub nus pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub nus pa thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because they have attained the ability to accomplish their own and others' goals.

original: ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga'i don sgrub nus pa thob pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba de ltar nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gnyi ga'i don sgrub nus pa thob pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba de ltar nyan thos la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Just as the bodhisattva who has realized the first stage has attained the ability to accomplish both his own and others' goals, so too the sravakas and so on have not,

original: rang gi don tsam sgrub nus pa thob pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang gi don tsam sgrub nus pa thob pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because they have attained the ability to accomplish only their own goals.

original: / de'i phyir de dag gis ni rab tu dga' ba zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: / de'i phyir de dag gis ni rab tu dga' ba zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not called joyful.

original: sa dang po mi rigs pas sa gong ma rnams kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: sa dang po mi rigs pas sa gong ma rnams kyang mi rigs te /
translated: Since the first stage is unreasonable, the higher stages are also unreasonable,

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are preceded by the first stage.

original: dri ma med pa ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad bral bas rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thams cad bral bas rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Stainless means that it is naturally endowed with morality, because it is free from all stains of immorality.

original: 'od ni chos kyi snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'od ni chos kyi snang ba ste /
translated: Light means the light of Dharma,

original: de byed pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pa'o //
translated: and it is the source of that light.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa nyams pa med pa'i gnas yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa nyams pa med pa'i gnas yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the abode of the undiminished meditative stabilization and meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams ni bsam gtan rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams ni bsam gtan rnams so //
translated: The concentrations are the meditative stabilizations.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni gzugs med pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainments are the formless states.

original: yang na ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mnyam par 'jog pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yang na ting nge 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mnyam par 'jog pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Or else, meditative stabilization, which has the characteristic of one-pointedness of mind, is meditative attainment,

original: mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: because it is the direct realization of the object.

original: mi nyams pas na nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi nyams pas na nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not lost, so it is non-loss.

original: chos kyi snang ba chen po'i gnas ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa de la ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang bral ba ma yin te /üîΩde dang ma bral bas na theg pa chen @258a * //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba chen po'i gnas ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sa de la ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang bral ba ma yin te / de dang ma bral bas na theg pa chen @258a * //
translated: The abode of the great light of the Dharma is as follows: the bodhisattva is not without meditative stabilization and meditative attainment on this spiritual level.

original: po'i mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams la snang ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: po'i mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams la snang ba 'thob bo //
translated: Because he is not without them, he obtains the light of the dharmas, i.e. the Sutras of the Great Vehicle etc.

original: de'i gnas yin pa dang rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas yin pa dang rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the luminous because it is the abode and cause of that light.

original: de la 'od 'phro ba yod bas na 'od 'phro ba can te /
analyzed: de la 'od 'phro ba yod bas na 'od 'phro ba can te /
translated: It is radiant because it has radiance.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams so //
translated: The factors of enlightenment.

original: de dag gi 'od 'phro ba ni sgrib pa thams cad bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'od 'phro ba ni sgrib pa thams cad bsregs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their light radiates because it burns up all obscurations.

original: sa de la byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyis mang du gnas pa'i phyir de dag gi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad thal par rlog go //
analyzed: sa de la byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyis mang du gnas pa'i phyir de dag gi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad thal par rlog go //
translated: On this spiritual level, because of the predominance of the factors of enlightenment, all the moral defilement and secondary defilement are completely destroyed.

original: shin tu sbyang bar bya dka' bas na shin tu sbyang dka' ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyang bar bya dka' bas na shin tu sbyang dka' ste /
translated: It is difficult to purify because it is difficult to purify.

original: sa de la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa'i phyir bden ba shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i ye ge dang / lag rtsis dang / bzo dang bstan bcos la sogs pa shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yang dag par sgrub po //
analyzed: sa de la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa'i phyir bden ba shes pa rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i ye ge dang / lag rtsis dang / bzo dang bstan bcos la sogs pa shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yang dag par sgrub po //
translated: On this spiritual level, he accomplishes the knowledge of the truth which is free from conceptual differentiation, because of his skill in the conventional and ultimate truth, and he also accomplishes the conceptual differentiation which consists in the knowledge of the mundane, such as the letters, calculation, craftsmanship, treatises and so on.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa mi mthun pa gnyis kyis bsgrub par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa mi mthun pa gnyis kyis bsgrub par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to purify because it is difficult to purify the conventional and ultimate truth by means of the two which are incompatible.

original: mngon du gyur pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The manifest itself is the manifest station of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sa de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas pa yin pas rkyen nyid 'di pa zhes bya ba shes pa'i stobs kyis rnam par mi rtog par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du byed do ;üîΩ; chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: sa de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas pa yin pas rkyen nyid 'di pa zhes bya ba shes pa'i stobs kyis rnam par mi rtog par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du byed do ; ; chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: On this stage, he is based on dependent origination, so by the power of knowing this very conditionality, he manifests the station of the perfection of wisdom free from conceptualization.üîΩHe does not distinguish any phenomena as defiled or

original: rnam par dag par bye brag mi 'byed do //
analyzed: rnam par dag par bye brag mi 'byed do //
translated: purified.

original: ring du song ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa'i mthar 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ring du song ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa'i mthar 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: Far-reaching is so called because it is the culmination of the practice of application.

original: gang gis sa de la sbyor ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de rtsol ba dang ldan par 'bad nas chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma la mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis sa de la sbyor ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de rtsol ba dang ldan par 'bad nas chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma la mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: By that, the practice of application on this stage is perfected, and he strives with effort and does not waver from the signs of all phenomena.

original: mi g-yo ba nyid ni mtshan ma thams cad dang mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis sa de la g-yos par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba nyid ni mtshan ma thams cad dang mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis sa de la g-yos par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Immovability: the signs and all the perfections cannot move it.

original: sa bdun pa la yang kun du mi spyod pas mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi g-yos par 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la yang kun du mi spyod pas mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi g-yos par 'dod mod kyi /
translated: On the seventh stage, it is asserted that it is not moved by any signs, because it does not engage in them.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med cing rang gi ngang gis ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med cing rang gi ngang gis ma yin la /
translated: But it is not spontaneous, because it is not effortless.

original: brgyad pa la ni bsgrim mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas 'di ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni bsgrim mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas 'di ni khyad par ro //
translated: On the eighth stage, it is spontaneous, because it proceeds effortlessly. This is the difference.

original: de'i blo gros legs pa yin pas /üîΩlegs pa'i blo gros te /
analyzed: de'i blo gros legs pa yin pas / legs pa'i blo gros te /
translated: It is the stage of Gone Afar, because it has gone farther than the other stages by the power of its superior progress.üîΩIt is the stage of the Immovable, because it is immovable by the conceptualization of signs and effort.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni dang po yang yin la so so yang dag par @258b rig pa'i shes pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa'i phyir ro // de ni dang po yang yin la so so yang dag par @258b rig pa'i shes pa yang yin pas /
translated: It is the stage of Excellent Wisdom, because it has attained the four discriminations.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang po'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang po'o //
translated: It is the first of the discriminations, because it is the first of the discriminations and the knowledge of the four discriminations.

original: shes pa ni blo gros zhes bya ba dang don gcig ste /
analyzed: shes pa ni blo gros zhes bya ba dang don gcig ste /
translated: Knowledge is synonymous with wisdom.

original: chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dar spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dar spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The analytical knowledges of phenomena, meaning, language, and ready speech.

original: 'di dag thob pas /
analyzed: 'di dag thob pas /
translated: By obtaining these,

original: chos kyi tshig kun mngon par mkhyen //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig kun mngon par mkhyen //
translated: one fully knows all the words of the Dharma.

original: don rnams kun gyi tshul la mkhas //üîΩskad kun rnam par 'byed pa mkhyen //
analyzed: don rnams kun gyi tshul la mkhas // skad kun rnam par 'byed pa mkhyen //
translated: One is skilled in the methods of all meanings.üîΩOne knows how to distinguish all languages.

original: phyogs rnams kun du spobs dang ldan //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun du spobs dang ldan // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One has ready speech in all directions.

original: dang po ni thog ma ste /
analyzed: dang po ni thog ma ste /
translated: The first is the beginning.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa sngon ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa sngon ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one previously obtained the knowledge of the characteristics of the analytical knowledges.

original: chos kyi sprin ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin pas 'dres pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin pas 'dres pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The Cloud of Dharma is called the observation of the mixed, etc. It is the observation of the mixed because it observes the mixed.

original: de ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa yang yin la chos thams cad shes pa yang yin pas 'dres pa la dmigs pa chos thams cad shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa yang yin la chos thams cad shes pa yang yin pas 'dres pa la dmigs pa chos thams cad shes pa'o //
translated: It is the observation of the mixed and the knowledge of all phenomena, so it is the observation of the mixed and the knowledge of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pas mdo'i sde la sogs pa chos thams cad bsdus pa la dmigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pas mdo'i sde la sogs pa chos thams cad bsdus pa la dmigs te /
translated: Since it is not other than thusness, it focuses on the totality of phenomena, such as the scriptural divisions of sutra and so on.

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul shes pa de ni sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul shes pa de ni sprin lta bu'o //
translated: The knowledge of the object that is the general characteristic of all phenomena is like a cloud.

original: de'i khor na ni sprin la chu ji lta bar ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo chu lta bu dag yod de /
analyzed: de'i khor na ni sprin la chu ji lta bar ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo chu lta bu dag yod de /
translated: Just as water is in the cloud, so the doors of meditative absorption and retention are like water in that knowledge.

original: de dag skyed par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag skyed par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is able to generate them.

original: ji ltar sprin gyi nam mkha' la sgrib par byed khabs par byad pa de bzhin du chos thams cad bsdus pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa des kyang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa chen po nam mkha' lta bu rgya che zhing mu med pa la sgrib
analyzed: ji ltar sprin gyi nam mkha' la sgrib par byed khabs par byad pa de bzhin du chos thams cad bsdus pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa des kyang nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa chen po nam mkha' lta bu rgya che zhing mu med pa la sgrib
translated: Just as a cloud covers and fills the sky, so that knowledge that focuses on the totality of phenomena also eliminates and fills the great skylike obscurations of affliction and the obscurations to omniscience.

original: par byed pa sel bar byed de //üîΩspong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par byed pa sel bar byed de //üîΩspong bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It eliminates, that is, it abandons.

original: yang ji ltar sprin gyis nam mkha' chus kun du 'gengs pa de bzhin du ye shes des kyang yon tan gyi tshogs kyi gnas chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: yang ji ltar sprin gyis nam mkha' chus kun du 'gengs pa de bzhin du ye shes des kyang yon tan gyi tshogs kyi gnas chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: Just as a cloud fills the sky with water, so this knowledge fills the realm of the Dharma Body with the mass of good qualities.

original: thob pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: thob pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the point of view of attainment,

original: rnam par bzhis blta ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par bzhis blta ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is to be seen in four ways.

original: mos pa thob pa ni sa'i dbang du bya ba bstan pa'i chos la 'di ni de zhin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa thob pa ni sa'i dbang du bya ba bstan pa'i chos la 'di ni de zhin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attainment of devotion is shown by the fact that one holds fast to the teaching of the Dharma as it is, on the basis of the stages.üîΩAttainment of practice is shown by the fact that one attains the ten practices of the teaching of the Dharma in accordance with the stages.

original: spyod pa thob pas zhes bya ba ni sa dang rab tu ldan pa'i bstan pa'i chos spyod pa bcu thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba las bstan pa'i chos spyod pa bcu ni /
analyzed: spyod pa thob pas zhes bya ba ni sa dang rab tu ldan pa'i bstan pa'i chos spyod pa bcu thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba las bstan pa'i chos spyod pa bcu ni /
translated: The ten practices of the teaching of the Dharma are:üîΩwriting, worship, giving, listening, reading, memorizing,

original: yi ge 'dri mchod sbyin pa dang // nyan dang klog dang 'dzin pa dang // 'chad dang kha ton byed pa dang / de sems pa dang sgom pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge 'dri mchod sbyin pa dang // nyan dang klog dang 'dzin pa dang // 'chad dang kha ton byed pa dang / de sems pa dang sgom pa'o //
translated: expounding, reciting, reflecting, and meditating on it.

original: rtogs pa thob pas @259a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa thob pas @259a * //
translated: Attainment of realization is shown by the fact that one attains the ten masteries over the teaching of the Dharma.

original: ni sa dang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa dang po yang dag par rtogs pa las thams cad rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ni sa dang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa dang po yang dag par rtogs pa las thams cad rtogs pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOn the first stage‚Äù and so on. All is realized from the realization of the first stage.

original: de dang rigs gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang rigs gcig pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is of the same kind as that.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ji ltar smyug tshigs dang po pa /üîΩbkas pa'i tshul ltar thams cad kyang //
analyzed: ji ltar smyug tshigs dang po pa / bkas pa'i tshul ltar thams cad kyang //
translated: Just as the first joint of a bambooüîΩis opened when it is split,

original: de ltar myur du 'gas par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar myur du 'gas par 'gyur //
translated: so all is quickly opened.

original: de bzhin ye shes gcig nas gcig / ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ye shes gcig nas gcig / ces bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the same way, from one wisdom to another.

original: 'grub pa thob pas ni bsgom pa'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub pa thob pas ni bsgom pa'i mthar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By attaining accomplishment, one goes to the end of meditation.

original: sa dang sa zhes bya ba ni sa re re la ste zlos pa'o //üîΩzhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: sa dang sa zhes bya ba ni sa re re la ste zlos pa'o // zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOn each stage‚Äù means on each stage, repeating.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Tranquility is concentration, the antidote to distraction.

original: lhag mthong ni phyin ci log gi gnyen po ste shes rab bo //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni phyin ci log gi gnyen po ste shes rab bo //
translated: Insight is wisdom, the antidote to error.

original: de gnyis sgom pa ni so so la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis sgom pa ni so so la brtson pa ste /
translated: Cultivating those two is striving for each.

original: rnam pa lngas ni goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni goms par byed pa'o //
translated: By five aspects, one becomes familiar with them.

original: 'dres par bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dres pa ni bsdus pa ste /üîΩsa gcig kho na la thams cad ngon par bsdus te goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang sgom pa na dmigs pa keng rus la sogs pa la thams cad 'des par byed do snyam pa de bsal ba'i phyir mtshan ma med par sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dres par bsgom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dres pa ni bsdus pa ste / sa gcig kho na la thams cad ngon par bsdus te goms par byed pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang sgom pa na dmigs pa keng rus la sogs pa la thams cad 'des par byed do snyam pa de bsal ba'i phyir mtshan ma med par sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The meditative cultivation of the signless is stated in order to eliminate the notion that meditative cultivation is the concentration of everything in just one object, such as a skeleton, since everything is concentrated in one object.

original: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan ma med pa sgom pa yang rtsol ba dang bcas shing 'bad pas 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam pa gsal ba'i phyir /üîΩlhun gyis grub par sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te bsgrim mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan ma med pa sgom pa yang rtsol ba dang bcas shing 'bad pas 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam pa gsal ba'i phyir /üîΩlhun gyis grub par sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te bsgrim mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative cultivation of the effortless is stated in order to eliminate the notion that the meditative cultivation of the signless is a meditative cultivation that is accompanied by effort and exertion, since it is a meditative cultivation that is free of all signs and is the undifferentiated expanse of reality.

original: lhun gyis grub par sgom pa yang mchog dang mchog ma yin pas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro snyam pa bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub par sgom pa yang mchog dang mchog ma yin pas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro snyam pa bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: To remove the idea that it is twofold, he says:

original: 'bar bar sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'bar bar sgom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúMeditation on blazing.‚Äù

original: 'bar ba dang mchog ces bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: 'bar ba dang mchog ces bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Blazing and supreme have the same meaning.

original: la la 'bar bar bsgom pa thob nas 'dis thams cad byas zin na gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes chog par 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: la la 'bar bar bsgom pa thob nas 'dis thams cad byas zin na gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes chog par 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: To remove the idea that some, having attained meditation on blazing, will be satisfied, thinking, ‚ÄúHaving done this, what else is there to do?‚Äù

original: chog par mi 'dzin par sgom pas so zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: chog par mi 'dzin par sgom pas so zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: he says: ‚ÄúMeditation without satisfaction.‚Äù

original: mtshan ma med pa 'bar bar bsgoms so zhes mi sbyor bar mi bya'i //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa 'bar bar bsgoms so zhes mi sbyor bar mi bya'i //
translated: One should not say, ‚ÄúI meditate without signs,‚Äù but

original: khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: one should strive in meditation in order to attain distinction.

original: gnas ngan len gyi gnas thams cad 'jig par byed ces bya ba la gnas ngan len gyi gnas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi gnas thams cad 'jig par byed ces bya ba la gnas ngan len gyi gnas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDestroying all the bases of negative reflex actions‚Äù means that the store-consciousness is the basis of negative reflex actions.

original: de 'jig par byed pa @259b ni tshogs su mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de 'jig par byed pa @259b ni tshogs su mi byed pa ste /
translated: Destroying it means not forming the collections.

original: tshogs 'jig pa'i phyir dper na sman bcud kyis len gyis nad kyi tshogs bzlog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshogs 'jig pa'i phyir dper na sman bcud kyis len gyis nad kyi tshogs bzlog pa bzhin no //
translated: Because the accumulations are destroyed, like the destruction of a disease by a medicinal elixir.üîΩHe is free from the notion of variety, and has attained the joy of the Dharma, because he is free from the signs of the notions of self, etc.üîΩHere, the joy is the joy of the Dharma, because it is the joy of the Dharma.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba thob ba zhes bya ba ni bdag dang chog dang sangs rgyas rgyas la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba thob ba zhes bya ba ni bdag dang chog dang sangs rgyas rgyas la sogs pa'i 'du shes kyi mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma here is the Dharma-element.

original: 'dir kun nas dga' bas na kun dga' ste /
analyzed: 'dir kun nas dga' bas na kun dga' ste /
translated: The joy of that is the satisfaction of that.üîΩFor example, it is like the joy of a certain sage in a forest grove or park outside.üîΩHe is free from the notion of variety, because he is free from the signs of the notions of self, etc.

original: chos nyid kun dga' yin pas chos kyi kun dga'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kun dga' yin pas chos kyi kun dga'o //
translated: He has attained the joy of the Dharma, because he is the joy of the Dharma.

original: chos ni 'dir chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: chos ni 'dir chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The Dharma here is the Dharma-element.

original: der dga' ba ni tshim pa ste /üîΩdper na yul can nam thub pa 'ga' zhig phyir rol gyi kun dga' ra ba'am /
analyzed: der dga' ba ni tshim pa ste / dper na yul can nam thub pa 'ga' zhig phyir rol gyi kun dga' ra ba'am /
translated: The joy of that is the satisfaction of that.

original: skyed mos tshal lam nags su dga' ba bzhin no //üîΩthams cad du tsam med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal lam nags su dga' ba bzhin no //üîΩthams cad du tsam med ces bya ba ni /
translated: For example, it is like the joy of a certain sage in a forest grove or park outside.

original: phyogs bcur 'dir tsam zhes yongs su ma chad pa dang / rnam pa tshad med pa'i phyir rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba yang dag par rnam par shes tshe /
analyzed: phyogs bcur 'dir tsam zhes yongs su ma chad pa dang / rnam pa tshad med pa'i phyir rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba yang dag par rnam par shes tshe /
translated: The light of the Dharma is not limited in terms of direction, because it is not limited to a certain place, such as here or there, and it is not limited in terms of aspect, because it has immeasurable aspects.

original: gzhung goms pa la lta ba bzhin no //üîΩrnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam par btags pa ma yin pa rnams de la kun du 'byung zhes bya ba la rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i cha la phan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhung goms pa la lta ba bzhin no // rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam par btags pa ma yin pa rnams de la kun du 'byung zhes bya ba la rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i cha la phan pa ste /
translated: When one fully understands the light of the Dharma, one is like one who is well trained in the scriptures.üîΩThe signs that are conducive to purification and are not fabricated arise in him.

original: rnam par dag pa ma skyes su zin kyang sangs rgyas dang / 'khor los sgyur ba dang / gdugs dkar po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam par gtags pa ma yin pa rnams kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ma skyes su zin kyang sangs rgyas dang / 'khor los sgyur ba dang / gdugs dkar po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam par gtags pa ma yin pa rnams kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: The signs of the Buddha, the universal monarch, the white parasol, and so on, which are conducive to purification, which are beneficial for the attainment of Buddhahood, arise in him, even though the state of purification has not yet arisen.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni sa bcu pa la'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par bya ba ni sa bcu pa la'o //
translated: The perfection of the Dharma body occurs on the tenth stage.

original: de nyid grub pa ni sa bcu gcig pas sangs rgyas kyi la la'o //
analyzed: de nyid grub pa ni sa bcu gcig pas sangs rgyas kyi la la'o //
translated: The accomplishment of that is on the eleventh stage, the stage of the Buddha.

original: gong ma bas ches gong ma ni gong nas gong du ste /üîΩsangs rgyas kyi sa'i rgyu mdzes pa nyid de /
analyzed: gong ma bas ches gong ma ni gong nas gong du ste / sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rgyu mdzes pa nyid de /
translated: Higher than that is higher than the higher,üîΩthe beauty of the stage of the Buddha.

original: rgyu shin tu bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu shin tu bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the beauty of the stage of the Buddha, because the cause is well-accumulated.

original: de ltar bsgom pa rnam pa lnga'i 'bras bu rnam pa 'di lnga go rims bzhin du brjod nas gtsor nas bcu dag tu pha rol tu phyir pa bcu bsgom par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba'i nges pa nyid brjodüîΩdo // sa so so la yang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu char sgom par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa rnam pa lnga'i 'bras bu rnam pa 'di lnga go rims bzhin du brjod nas gtsor nas bcu dag tu pha rol tu phyir pa bcu bsgom par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba'i nges pa nyid brjod do // sa so so la yang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu char sgom par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Having thus described the five kinds of results of the five kinds of meditation in their proper order, he says, ‚ÄúThe ten perfections are cultivated in the ten stages.‚Äù

original: sa 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sgom par 'gyur ro zhes nges par bya ba ni mi rigs so zhe na //üîΩgtsor na zhes bya ba smos pas nyes pa med de /
analyzed: sa 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa 'di sgom par 'gyur ro zhes nges par bya ba ni mi rigs so zhe na // gtsor na zhes bya ba smos pas nyes pa med de /
translated: The ten perfections are cultivated in the ten stages, but it is not reasonable to say that the ten perfections are cultivated in each stage.

original: gang la gtsor gang sgom par 'gyur ba de de la ston @260a * //
analyzed: gang la gtsor gang sgom par 'gyur ba de de la ston @260a * //
translated: There is no fault in saying ‚Äúprimarily,‚Äù because it is taught that the perfection that is primary in a particular stage is cultivated in that stage.

original: gyi ; der gzhan yang sgom par 'gyur ba dgag pa ni med de /
analyzed: gyi ; der gzhan yang sgom par 'gyur ba dgag pa ni med de /
translated: There is no other meditation to be stopped there.

original: mdo las ji skad du sa rab du dga' ba de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du sa rab du dga' ba de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par che ba yin te /

analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang yang dag par mi sgrub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: 'dir thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir thabs la mkhas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is skill in method here?

original: gang 'khor ba yang yongs su mi gtong la mya ngan las 'das pa yang don du gnyer ba de thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba yang yongs su mi gtong la mya ngan las 'das pa yang don du gnyer ba de thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: It is not to abandon samsara and to strive for nirvana.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o snyam nas sems cad thams cad dang thun mong du byed des sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong bas 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o snyam nas sems cad thams cad dang thun mong du byed des sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong bas 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: He does not abandon samsara, because he does not abandon sentient beings.üîΩ He does not seek nirvana, because he thinks, I will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment.

original: smon lam sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pa ni smon pa'i don mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smon lam sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pa ni smon pa'i don mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: He does not abandon samsara, because he does not abandon sentient beings.üîΩ He does not seek nirvana, because he thinks, I will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment

original: sangs rgyas su grub shig / sems can thams cad kyi don byed par gsog shig ces bya ba la sogs pas de mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir gang la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rkyen yod pa der skye'o //üîΩstobs kyi pha rol tu phyi pa ni so sor rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su grub shig / sems can thams cad kyi don byed par gsog shig ces bya ba la sogs pas de mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir gang la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rkyen yod pa der skye'o // stobs kyi pha rol tu phyi pa ni so sor rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One should accomplish Buddhahood, One should work for the welfare of all sentient beings, etc.üîΩThe perfection of power is the condition for the perfection of the powers.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs ni bsgom pa'i stobs med pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs ni bsgom pa'i stobs med pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The power of discernment is when the power of meditation is absent.

original: yod pa'i dus na ni gnyi ga yang yod de /
analyzed: yod pa'i dus na ni gnyi ga yang yod de /
translated: When it is present, both are present.

original: stobs cig shos kyang de na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs cig shos kyang de na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other power is also present there.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is the establishment of the six perfections.

original: grangs dang de'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis /
analyzed: grangs dang de'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis /
translated: By the distinctions of number, their characteristics, etc.

original: cho la longs spyod pas myong ngo //
analyzed: cho la longs spyod pas myong ngo //
translated: One experiences through the enjoyment of objects.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: This is generosity.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: This is morality.

original: 'di ni bzod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa ste /
translated: This is patience.üîΩIt is of such and such a nature, etc.

original: @260b mtshan nyid 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa shes pas sgra ji bzhin ma yin par cho khong du chud pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: @260b mtshan nyid 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa shes pas sgra ji bzhin ma yin par cho khong du chud pa'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Thus, by understanding the meaning that is not literal, one brings beings to full maturity.üîΩThese four perfections are called the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bcu pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang de'i rjes la thob pa nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnam par gzhag pa 'dir ni
analyzed: yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bcu pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang de'i rjes la thob pa nyid pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rnam par gzhag pa 'dir ni
translated: In this presentation of the ten perfections, the perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual wisdom and the subsequently attained wisdom.

original: thabs la sogs pa pha rol tu phyi pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: thabs la sogs pa pha rol tu phyi pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Here, the four perfections of means and so on are taught to be perfections.

original: gang gi tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang de'i rjes la thob pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu rnam par gzhag pa de'i tshe ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang de'i rjes la thob pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: When the perfections are presented as six, then nonconceptual wisdom and subsequently attained wisdom are the perfection of wisdom.

original: bzhi po dag der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi po dag der 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four perfections are included in those two.

original: sa bcu pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs de pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa sde snod ni thag pa chen po'i cho thams cad de /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs de pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la pha rol tu phyin pa sde snod ni thag pa chen po'i cho thams cad de /
translated: The Dharma of the tenth stage is included in the Pi·π≠aka of the Perfections.üîΩThe Pi·π≠aka of the Perfections is the entire body of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: des sa bcu pa 'di bsdus so //
analyzed: des sa bcu pa 'di bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the tenth stage is included in the Pi·π≠aka of the Perfections.

original: de lta bas nas thams cad du pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par mi 'gyur pa yang ma yin zhes khungs brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bas nas thams cad du pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par mi 'gyur pa yang ma yin zhes khungs brjod do //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that the cultivation of the perfections is not everywhere.üîΩThe five persons are completed in three incalculable aeons.

original: gang zag lnga ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang zag gcig nyid la gnas skabs tha dad po mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag lnga ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gang zag gcig nyid la gnas skabs tha dad po mos pas spyod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: One person, in different situations, becomes five types, distinguished as the stage of action from faith, etc.

original: de la lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa la spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa la spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The one who practices with pure superior intention is also of two types:

original: mtshan ma la spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma la spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: one who practices with signs and one who practices without signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The one who practices without signs is also of two types:

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang mngon par 'du mi byed pa la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang mngon par 'du mi byed pa la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they practice with and without exertion.

original: de la mos pas spyod pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mos pas spyod pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos sa dang po yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The practice of devoted engagement is completed in the first countless eon and the first level is perfected.

original: de las de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one realizes thatness on that level.üîΩThe practice of pure superior intention is completed in the second countless eon and the first six levels are perfected.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas la spyod pas drug po dag tu mtshan ma dang bcas pa la spyod pa dang / bdun pa la mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas la spyod pas drug po dag tu mtshan ma dang bcas pa la spyod pa dang / bdun pa la mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The practice with signs is on the first six levels and the practice without signs is on the seventh level.

original: de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa ni de yan chad sa bcu pa'i bar du bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pas bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa ni de yan chad sa bcu pa'i bar du bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pas bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The practice without exertion is completed in the third countless eon and the remaining levels are perfected.

original: brgyad pa la ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa nyid yongs su grub bo //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa nyid yongs su grub bo //
translated: The practice without exertion is perfected on the eighth level.

original: dgu pa dang bcu pa la ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgu pa dang bcu pa la ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa nyid do //
translated: In the ninth and tenth stages, he practices without manifest activity.

original: @261a * // gang zag gcig kho na la gnas skabs gzhan dang ldan pas tha dad de /
analyzed: @261a * // gang zag gcig kho na la gnas skabs gzhan dang ldan pas tha dad de /
translated: One person is differentiated by having different states,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩ'o na thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba la gang nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa bzhin no // 'o na thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba la gang nas bzung ste /
translated: like a stream-enterer and so on.üîΩIf that is so, then in beginningless samsara, from what point is the beginning of the three incalculable aeons counted?

original: grangs med pa gsum gyi rtsom pa bgrang zhes dri ba khong du bzhag ste tshigs su bcad pas ston to ;
analyzed: grangs med pa gsum gyi rtsom pa bgrang zhes dri ba khong du bzhag ste tshigs su bcad pas ston to ;
translated: This question is left in the air, and is resolved in the verse.üîΩThe verse says: The one with good power, the one with the power of vow,üîΩthe one with the power of roots, the one with the power of knowledge,üîΩthe one with the power of mind, and the one with the power of action.

original: / bzang dang smon pa'i stobs can dang // zhes bya ba la bzang po ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: / bzang dang smon pa'i stobs can dang // zhes bya ba la bzang po ni dge ba ste /
translated: Good means virtue.

original: de stobs dang ldan par gyur pa ni bzang po'i stobs can te /
analyzed: de stobs dang ldan par gyur pa ni bzang po'i stobs can te /
translated: The one who has the power of that is the one with the power of good.

original: de la de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has that.

original: smon pa ni 'dir smon lam du 'dod de /
analyzed: smon pa ni 'dir smon lam du 'dod de /
translated: Vow is asserted here as a vow.

original: de la de yod pas smon lam gyi stobs can no //
analyzed: de la de yod pas smon lam gyi stobs can no //
translated: Because he has that, he has the power of vow.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs can ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs can ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the one with the power of roots is not overcome by adverse factors.

original: smon lam gyi stobs can ni rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs can ni rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of prayer is the constant presence of the spiritual teacher.

original: sems brtan pa nyid ni mi dge ba'i grogs pos mos pa bzlog kyang byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems brtan pa nyid ni mi dge ba'i grogs pos mos pa bzlog kyang byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Firmness of mind is the non-abandonment of the thought of enlightenment, even when the inclination is turned away by the company of the unvirtuous.

original: khyad par 'gro ba ni mthong ba'i chos dang tshe rabs phyi ma la dge ba'i chos 'phel ba dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs can dang / sems brtan te bar mdor mi ldog pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ste /üîΩyon tan cung zad kyis chog par mi 'dzin pa de nas bzung ste /
analyzed: khyad par 'gro ba ni mthong ba'i chos dang tshe rabs phyi ma la dge ba'i chos 'phel ba dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i phyir ro // de ltar gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs can dang / sems brtan te bar mdor mi ldog pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ste / yon tan cung zad kyis chog par mi 'dzin pa de nas bzung ste /
translated: Progress is the increase of the virtuous dharmas in this life and the next, and the non-loss of the thought of enlightenment.

original: grangs med pa gsum brtsam mo //
analyzed: grangs med pa gsum brtsam mo //
translated: Thus, when the roots of virtue, the power of prayer, and firmness of mind are such that one does not turn back in the middle, and there is progress, then, not being satisfied with a little virtue, one begins the three incalculable aeons.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rab tu dbye ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rab tu dbye ba bshad zin to //
translated: The division of cause and effect has been explained.

original: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te bslab pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te bslab pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ste /
translated: The training in superior morality is the training in morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la der ji skad bshad snyam pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la der ji skad bshad snyam pa la /
translated: As it is explained in the Bodhisattva Stages.

original: mdor bsdu na khyad par rnam pa bzhis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na khyad par rnam pa bzhis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In brief, it is distinguished by four special qualities.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par ni sdom pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba sdud pa dang sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par ni sdom pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba sdud pa dang sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special distinction of analysis is that it is threefold: the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring virtue, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa thams cad du mi dge ba spong ba yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa thams cad du mi dge ba spong ba yang dag par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The morality of restraint is the taking up of the vow to abandon all that is unwholesome.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa thams cad du dge ba'i chos yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa thams cad du dge ba'i chos yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The morality of acquiring virtue is the taking up of the vow to cultivate all that is wholesome.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims ni bdag gi bde ba la mi chags mi lta bar rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi @261b don byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims ni bdag gi bde ba la mi chags mi lta bar rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi @261b don byed pa'o //
translated: The morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings is the vow to act for the benefit of sentient beings without regard for one's own happiness or possessions.

original: tshul khrims gnyis kyi rten gyi don du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshul khrims gnyis kyi rten gyi don du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: One should understand that it is the basis of the two kinds of morality.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid bsdams na sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa yang dag par sgrub pa dang / yang dag par phul du phyin pa thob par byed kyang nus la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid bsdams na sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa yang dag par sgrub pa dang / yang dag par phul du phyin pa thob par byed kyang nus la /
translated: Because it is the cause: if one restrains body, speech, and mind, one is able to accomplish and attain the most excellent, perfect qualities of a Buddha,

original: theg pa gsum la 'dzud pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skal ba can du yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: theg pa gsum la 'dzud pas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i skal ba can du yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: and one becomes fit to ripen beings by introducing them to the three vehicles.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi khyad par te /
translated: This is the difference in morality between the bodhisattva and the sravaka, etc.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la bslab pa gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la bslab pa gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latter do not have the two trainings.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'o zhes bstan te /
translated: The morality of restraint is also superior.

original: bslab pa thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba de la bslab pa thun mong ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa rnams te /
analyzed: bslab pa thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba de la bslab pa thun mong ba ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa rnams te /
translated: The common training is that which is naturally reprehensible,

original: bkag pa bcas pa med par yang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can srog gcod pa la sogs pa nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' gnyi gas mi bya bar nges par mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bkag pa bcas pa med par yang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can srog gcod pa la sogs pa nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' gnyi gas mi bya bar nges par mthun pa'o //
translated: because it definitely has an undesirable result, such as taking life, etc., even without being prohibited by a rule. It is common to both sravakas and bodhisattvas.

original: bslab pa thun mong ma yin pa ni bcad pas bkag pa bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa rnams te /
analyzed: bslab pa thun mong ma yin pa ni bcad pas bkag pa bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa rnams te /
translated: The uncommon training is that which is reprehensible because of being prohibited by a rule.

original: dbyar gyi nang logs su 'gro ba la sogs pa kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro //

original: khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni khye'u snga ma khye'u phyi mas dbyung ba'i tshul du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /üîΩdper na khye'u phra mos khye'u sbom po 'byin pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam @263b par shes pa la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon bag chags kyi bdag nyid rags pa gnas pa thams cad de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa gnyen po'i shes
analyzed: khye'us khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni khye'u snga ma khye'u phyi mas dbyung ba'i tshul du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste / dper na khye'u phra mos khye'u sbom po 'byin pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam @263b par shes pa la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon bag chags kyi bdag nyid rags pa gnas pa thams cad de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa gnyen po'i shes
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the manner of a child emerging from the womb‚Äù means that the later child emerges in the manner of the earlier child.

original: pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin phra mos 'byin to //
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin phra mos 'byin to //
translated: Just as a small child emerges from the womb of a larger child, in the same way, the subtle meditative absorption that is endowed with the knowledge that focuses on suchness and that is the antidote to the seeds of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience that are present in the form of predispositions in the foundation consciousness emerges from the foundation consciousness.

original: las su rung ba nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba ni bsam gtan gyis de ba dag gis gnas nas bsam gtan las yongs su ma nyams pa bzhin du ji ltar 'dod pa gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba der skye ste /
analyzed: las su rung ba nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba ni bsam gtan gyis de ba dag gis gnas nas bsam gtan las yongs su ma nyams pa bzhin du ji ltar 'dod pa gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba der skye ste /
translated: The classification of the perfection of meditative absorption in terms of its function is that, having remained in meditative absorption, one is reborn wherever one sees that it is necessary to benefit sentient beings, just as if one were not falling from the meditative absorptions.

original: ting nge 'dzin las su rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las su rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one has mastered meditative absorption.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi las su rung ba nyid ni nyan thos la sogs pa nyid la med do //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi las su rung ba nyid ni nyan thos la sogs pa nyid la med do //
translated: Such serviceability of concentration does not exist for sravakas, etc.

original: mngon par bsgrub pas rab tu dbye ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan gyis 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rnams su thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa skyed do //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pas rab tu dbye ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan gyis 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rnams su thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa skyed do //
translated: The classification of its accomplishment is that by the qualities of concentration, one generates unobstructed superknowledge in immeasurable world systems.

original: de la g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa 'byung ste /
translated: Therein, the emanation of movement, etc., occurs.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa g-yo bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'gul bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa g-yo bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mthus 'gul bar byed pa ste /
translated: The movement of immeasurable world systems is the shaking by the power of concentration.

original: 'bar par byed pa dang khyab par byed pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bar par byed pa dang khyab par byed pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The burning and pervading are similar.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mthong bar mi nus pa mtha' yas pa gzhan dag gam sangs rgyas la sogs pa yang ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mthong bar mi nus pa mtha' yas pa gzhan dag gam sangs rgyas la sogs pa yang ston to //
translated: One displays immeasurable world systems, other than those that cannot be seen, and also Buddhas, etc.

original: sa la sogs pa yang pa yang chu la sogs pa'i dngos por gzhan du sgyur ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa yang pa yang chu la sogs pa'i dngos por gzhan du sgyur ro //
translated: One transforms earth, etc., into other things, such as water, etc.

original: skad cig gis 'jig rten gyi khams du mar 'gro'o //
analyzed: skad cig gis 'jig rten gyi khams du mar 'gro'o //
translated: In an instant, he goes to many world systems.

original: 'ong ngo ; ; rdul phra rab gcig gi nang du 'jig rten gyi khams mang po sdud kyang cher mi skye bar byed do //
analyzed: 'ong ngo ; ; rdul phra rab gcig gi nang du 'jig rten gyi khams mang po sdud kyang cher mi skye bar byed do //
translated: He brings many world systems into a single atom without enlarging the atom.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams su rdul gcig gis rgyas par byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams su rdul gcig gis rgyas par byed de /
translated: With a single atom, he fills up limitless world systems.

original: khyab par byed do //
analyzed: khyab par byed do //
translated: He pervades them.

original: rang gi lus su gzugs kyi lus thams cad 'jug go //
analyzed: rang gi lus su gzugs kyi lus thams cad 'jug go //
translated: He causes all form bodies to enter his own body.

original: gdul pa'i phyir gang gi gzugs gang yin pa de'i gan du gzugs de nyid kyis 'gro'o //
analyzed: gdul pa'i phyir gang gi gzugs gang yin pa de'i gan du gzugs de nyid kyis 'gro'o //
translated: In order to tame, he goes to whomever with whatever form is necessary.

original: snang bar byed pa ni mngon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa ni mngon par byed pa'o //
translated: Illumination is manifestation.

original: mi snang bar byed pa ni mi mngon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi snang bar byed pa ni mi mngon par byed pa'o //
translated: Non-illumination is non-manifestation.

original: dbang nyid du byed pa ni bdud sangs rgyas nyid du sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang nyid du byed pa ni bdud sangs rgyas nyid du sgyur ba'o //
translated: Domination is transforming Mara into a Buddha.

original: gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul rab tu 'joms pa ni gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon pa'o ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul rab tu 'joms pa ni gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon pa'o ;
translated: Overpowering the miracles of others is surpassing the miracles of others.

original: ; spobs pa med pa rnams la spobs pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: ; spobs pa med pa rnams la spobs pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives eloquence to those who lack it.

original: brjed ngas pa rnams la dran pa sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa rnams la dran pa sbyin par byed do //
translated: He gives mindfulness to the forgetful.

original: gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'gug par 'gyur ba pho nya lta bu'i 'od zer gtong ste /üîΩgang dag nyan thos la sogs pa la med pa'i rdzu 'phrul chen po 'di dag @264a * //
analyzed: gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'gug par 'gyur ba pho nya lta bu'i 'od zer gtong ste / gang dag nyan thos la sogs pa la med pa'i rdzu 'phrul chen po 'di dag @264a * //
translated: He emits the ray Encouraging the Messengers, and the bodhisattvas who are summoned by it

original: mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: They manifest great miracles, such as the shaking of the earth, which are not found among the disciples and so on.

original: gang dka' ba spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod pa dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa bcu po de dag ston to //
analyzed: gang dka' ba spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod pa dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa bcu po de dag ston to //
translated: These ten kinds of difficult tasks are taught as the difficult tasks of the bodhisattvas.

original: khas blang bar dka' ba spyod pa ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa khas len pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khas blang bar dka' ba spyod pa ni byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa khas len pa'i phyir te /
translated: The difficult task of accepting is the acceptance of the vow of aspiration for great enlightenment.

original: dka' pa ni bdag gi bde ba la mi lta bar gzhan gyi don byed par dam 'cha' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' pa ni bdag gi bde ba la mi lta bar gzhan gyi don byed par dam 'cha' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The difficult task of difficulty is the vow to work for the welfare of others without regard for one's own happiness.

original: mi ldog par dka' ba spyod pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal grang ba dang rlung la sogs pas mi zlogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldog par dka' ba spyod pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal grang ba dang rlung la sogs pas mi zlogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difficult task of nonretrogression is the nonretrogression from the suffering of cyclic existence, from cold, wind, and so on.

original: phyir mi phyogs pa ni sems can log par sgrub pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi don bya dka' ba las phyir mi phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi phyogs pa ni sems can log par sgrub pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi don bya dka' ba las phyir mi phyogs pa ste /
translated: Not turning away is not turning away from the difficult task of helping those who are wrongly oriented.

original: gang dag ma la sogs pa la log par sgrub pa dang / brtse ba'i phyir mi dgos par yang mig bslangs nas rkang pa gnyis kyis 'dril ba de'i don bya dka' ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag ma la sogs pa la log par sgrub pa dang / brtse ba'i phyir mi dgos par yang mig bslangs nas rkang pa gnyis kyis 'dril ba de'i don bya dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to help those who are wrongly oriented toward their mothers and so on, who, out of love, are not needed and yet ask for their eyes and are rolled up with their feet.

original: mngon du phyogs par dka' pa ni gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi don bya ba bya dka' ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du phyogs par dka' pa ni gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi don bya ba bya dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to help those who are hostile.

original: 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos rnyed pa la sogs pa brgyad kyis mi gos pa ni dka' ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos rnyed pa la sogs pa brgyad kyis mi gos pa ni dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to be born in the world and not be defiled by the eight worldly dharmas such as gain.

original: rtogs pa med par yang theg pa chen po'i don phra zhing mthu'i khyad par can la mos shing dad par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa med par yang theg pa chen po'i don phra zhing mthu'i khyad par can la mos shing dad par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to have faith and devotion to the profound and special power of the Mahayana meaning without realization.

original: rtogs pa ni mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa ni mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Realization is clear realization.

original: yang dag par khong du chud ces bya ba dang don gcig go //
analyzed: yang dag par khong du chud ces bya ba dang don gcig go //
translated: It is the same as perfect understanding.

original: gang zag dang chos med pa'i ngo bo nyid kun brtags pa dgag pa'i sgo nas bya dka' ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos med pa'i ngo bo nyid kun brtags pa dgag pa'i sgo nas bya dka' ba'o //
translated: The difficulty of the person and the teaching is the difficult practice in terms of the refutation of the imagined nature, which is the nonexistence of persons and things.

original: khong du chud pa ni dgongs te gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni dgongs te gsungs pa'o //
translated: Understanding is the teaching with an underlying thought.

original: dka' ba ni thos pa'i don btang ste /
analyzed: dka' ba ni thos pa'i don btang ste /
translated: The difficulty is the understanding of the meaning of what is heard,

original: ma thos pa'i don rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'khor ba yang yongs su mi gtong la de'i nyes pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni dka' ba ste /
analyzed: ma thos pa'i don rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir ro // 'khor ba yang yongs su mi gtong la de'i nyes pas kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni dka' ba ste /
translated: because it is the understanding of the meaning of what is not heard.üîΩThe difficulty of not forsaking samsara and not being defiled by its faults is the difficulty of not distinguishing the two,

original: de gnyis mi 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis mi 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not forsake samsara and is not defiled by its faults.

original: sbyor bar dka' ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib thams cad las rnam par grol ba spangs pa la zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sbyor bar dka' ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib thams cad las rnam par grol ba spangs pa la zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difficulty of application is the special activity for the benefit of sentient beings of the Tathagatas who have entered the abandonment that is the complete liberation from all the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable.

original: gal te sbyin pa cung zad mi sbyin la zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas sems can thams cad bdag gir byas te sbyin pa de byang chub sems dpas sbyin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa cung zad mi sbyin la zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas sems can thams cad bdag gir byas te sbyin pa de byang chub sems dpas sbyin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If he does not give the slightest thing, he is a bodhisattva who gives, because he has taken all sentient beings as his own due to his realization of the sameness of self and others.

original: thams cad la thams cad sbyin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la thams cad sbyin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: He is intent on giving everything to everyone.

original: yang na sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin par byed pa dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas @264b so ;
analyzed: yang na sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin par byed pa dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas @264b so ;
translated: Or else, because he does not perceive the three sectors of giving, he is a bodhisattva who gives, due to the purity of the three sectors.

original: ; gal te sbyin pa thams cad la 'dod par mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bkag pa la 'dod pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ; gal te sbyin pa thams cad la 'dod par mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni bkag pa la 'dod pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: If he does not desire any giving at all, he is a bodhisattva who gives, because he has no desire for the prohibition.

original: nye ba la sbyin pa dang / bdag la sbyin pa byin pa dang / bdag la sbyin pa byin par 'gyur ba dang / bdag gi snga rabs rnams kyis byin pas sbyin no snyam pa de la 'dod par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: nye ba la sbyin pa dang / bdag la sbyin pa byin pa dang / bdag la sbyin pa byin par 'gyur ba dang / bdag gi snga rabs rnams kyis byin pas sbyin no snyam pa de la 'dod par mi byed kyi /
translated: He does not desire giving to a neighbor, giving to himself, giving that will be given to him, or giving that was given to his ancestors.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pa dang / dngos po la mi gnas par 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la dmigs pa dang / dngos po la mi gnas par 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: and aims for nirvana, and does not wish to remain in existence.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dad pas mi 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis rigs par bya ba'i chos nyid khong du chud nas rang gi rtogs pas sbyin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dad pas mi 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba ni so so rang gis rigs par bya ba'i chos nyid khong du chud nas rang gi rtogs pas sbyin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he does not go to the Tathagatas with faith, he does not go to them with faith, but he does go to them with understanding, because he has penetrated the Dharma which is to be understood by each one for himself.

original: gal te bdag sbyin pa la 'jug par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas sbyin pa'i phyir de la bdag nyid 'jug mi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag sbyin pa la 'jug par mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas sbyin pa'i phyir de la bdag nyid 'jug mi dgos pa'o //
translated: If he does not engage himself in generosity, he does not need to engage himself in generosity, because he engages himself in generosity spontaneously.

original: gzhan ni 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan ni 'jug par byed de /
translated: But he engages others in generosity, because he causes them to take it up.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro gal te lan 'ga' sbyin pa ci yang sbyin par mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtag tu thams cad sbyin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro gal te lan 'ga' sbyin pa ci yang sbyin par mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtag tu thams cad sbyin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he does not give anything at all, he gives everything, because he gives constantly.

original: gal te sbyin pa la snying po med pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la mi 'phro ba na ting nge 'dzin te //
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa la snying po med pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la mi 'phro ba na ting nge 'dzin te //
translated: If he has the notion that generosity is without essence, he does not scatter his mind.

original: des sems rnam par mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sems rnam par mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is meditative concentration, because it does not scatter the mind.

original: der 'du shes pa ni mnyam par bzhag pas sbyin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der 'du shes pa ni mnyam par bzhag pas sbyin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The notion of that refers to the notion of meditative concentration.

original: gal te ser sna 'byung bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtsa nas 'byin ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te ser sna 'byung bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni rtsa nas 'byin ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he generates avarice, he does not give rise to it.

original: gal te mtha' la mi gnas par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni zhi bar bgrod pa gcig pu la nyan thos ltar gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mtha' la mi gnas par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni zhi bar bgrod pa gcig pu la nyan thos ltar gnas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: If he does not abide in the extreme, he does not abide like the Sravakas in the one path to peace.

original: gal te sbyin pa la dbang byed pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa dbang byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa la dbang byed pa ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa dbang byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he does not control generosity, he does not control the resistance to generosity, i.e., avarice, etc.

original: gal te mi zad pa la mi gnas par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa phul du byung ba'i mthar thug pa sangs rgyas nyid thob nas de nyid du mi gnas kyi /üîΩsprul pa rnams kyis gzhan la phan gdags pa'i phyir sbyin pa la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: If one says, ‚ÄúI will completely turn away all living beings from cyclic existence,‚Äù this means ‚ÄúI will liberate them.‚Äù

analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par brtag par bya ba kun brtags pa'i don med pas de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes mdo las 'byung ngo //
